pageContext.desc: Family life, farming, and trips to Chicago.

pages.transcription:
May
1st Weather very cold, no grass cattle almost in a state of 
15. starvation. Not a bird started on anything except currants and Gooseberrys. weathers continues cold no grass yet of any account?. 
18 Alferd got here, weather cold yet, not a green leaf on apple or cherry? 
20 tree, Went to mill chilly north wind, Lovina and Alferd went 
21 to Mr. Irishs, First warmer day in may, grass begins to look quite green cattle can get their living birds begin to swell. 
24 Had a dish of lettuce. We had six warm lovely days and the 
25 effects is almost wonderful from bare leafless trees we have cherry and plum in full blossom and apple trees all budded and leaved out so they look quite green and the prospect for frost quite flattening Lovina started for Minnesota to day. 
26 Rain cleaned the milk house
June 18? Went to Chicago on a law trial 20. Had first Gooseberrys,
28 Had first Strawberrys. 29, Peter Styne died
July, 4, Girls went to Chicago Edward came home with them
5 All went Strawberrying in Beaubins? woods, 11. Had first beets
12 Had first Cucumbers. went to hear Henriettas Fergusons funeral Sermon Preached had an awful thunder storm in the after noon Richard Haywood and wife stayed all night with us.
18 Went to Chicago horse ran away th^rew us out off the buggy
21 Had first ^new Potatoes Beans Peas and Squash. 27 Picked cherrys to dry
31 Went to Chicago carried carpet rags.
August, 9 Heard first crickets sing. 10. Had green corn. 14. Picked Apples
15 Clark and Martha went to Chicago brought home the carpet
17 Made carpet and put it down and picked the last of our cherrys
23 Josephine came out here. 25. Mrs Naphier started for Terre Haute
Sept. 1 Josephine went home. 4 Cooked the first ripe Tomatoes and picked unclear
9 Had a quilting Lilac unclear 13. Lovitte? Cow went off.
30 First hard frost, all went to the woods to gather nuts got verxy few
Oct. 26 Mr Pard? and Mary came out here and stayed all night
30 Mr Robbins and wife came and stayed two nights
Nov. 4 Killed Patty, 15. Elbert came here first from Vt.
17. Went to Chicago stayed all night great snow storm could not

home untill the 29, weather very cold people sleigh riding 
in town. 24. school commenced. 26. Thanksgiving clear beautiful day
Clear beautiful day Colista Irish married.
Cloudy raw wind cold disagreeable day. 11. Clark and Martha started (west creek) 
Clear warm pleasant day. 21. Clark and Martha got back from west creek
Clear warm pleasant day cooked a turkey had James and Delia to help sat i-
Went up to James to eat New Years dinner the evening  the girls went to
Mr Beaubins to a dance, 4 Clark went to Chicago with the first load of
twisted hay. 10, Rain and wind very disagreeable day
Adeline went to Cazenoria to a ball, 20. went to Mer Penoyere

1859
30 Girls washed for Louis folks very heavy thunder shower 
Aug, 2 Ada and Josephine went to Mr Gleasons to a party 4. Went to Chicago with Martha to get her crockery 18 May Everet came home on a visit 
Sept, 11, Bought colt of James Knott. May, 24, Sold horse to David Chapin 
Oct, 7, Received money of Mr. Willey for land gave him deed, Girls went to Higgins Ball 
13 Colt died, 15 Girls wen to John Shermons to a party. 17 Received letter from Leonard Perry, 18 Went to Chicago came home on the cars. 
Nov. 4 Mr Parish commenced plastering the chamber worked 9 day rained all the time 
7 cloudy sun has not shone but two or three times in as many weeks 
10 Went to Chicago to find rooms to  live in stayed three nights 
21 Went to meeting in a sleigh, 30 Clark and Tom had their raffle 
Dec, 1 Young folks had a candy pull at our house very bad going 
2 Moved to Chicago had an awful time getting through the mud 
Feb 14, 1859 Martha came in and Marietta 
28 went home with her, 25. Snowy storm Went home with Clark broke down Perry Tanner carried me home 
March, stayed until friday. (4th of march) came back to Chicago I sent a letter unclear 
12 Had Mariettas likeness taken, 15  Had Mariettas likeness taken for Mr. Perry 
16 Moved home had an awful time had the horses down and had to leave part of our things on the road, 28 Sowed lettuce 
April. 5 Set strawberry plants 10 Marthas baby come to town, 
May, 3 Big cherry tree in full blossom also Currants and Gooseberrys 5. Had first lettuce 
6 Oak trees begining to leave out 10 Apples trees in full bloom, weather very cold made fires in the garden. Mrs. Brooks & Olive Tanner here visiting staid all night 
21 Had first Pie Plant Pie. 25 Made first currant pie Girls went up to J. Shermans to a picnic, 30 Had first Gooseberrys stewed 31. Clark took a peck of green currants to Chicago .
June 1 Very hot and windy. 4 Very cold had frost beans and tomatoes grapes. hilled cherrys Gooseberrys and currants a good deal injured froze corn and Potatoes and ice the thickness of a window glass. 5 First Sabbath school in our school (hooke), (May, 20, Adaline comminced her school)
26 Girls went to Wheeling to camp meeting 28. Weather very hot 
July. 3, Very cold slight frost 4 cool nice evening had fire works. Adaline went to Snells to a dance, with Tuttle. 7 Picked currants to sell 
Aug. 10 Baby taken sick, 14 Lornenda Kering came to see us. 26, Baby died 
Oct 28 We all went to the burying ground to see Adelas grave

1860             Marietta
30 Went to Brichton Church dedication,
Nov. 4, Clark Martha Margaret and Adaline all went to Chicago had their likenesses taken, bought parsnip, 6, 35, 7. School commenced 
12 Snow and very cold freezing weather, 13, 14 Still contenuses very cold Clark started for Michigan, 20, Martha and I went to Chicago Martha had her likeness taken 25, Received a letter from J. N. Mansfield 
Dec. 5 First writing school, 6, Mrs. Willey Mrs Gunnison and myself went to Mrs. Willises a visiting went in a sleigh weather extremely cold 
Nov. 28 David Chapin moved here, Dec, 18  Girls went to Mrs. Tanners in a sleigh 
25, Christmas all went up to Aaron Rowley.s in a sleigh,
Jan, 4, 1860, Adaline got her picture frame, 10, Went to Chicago in a sleigh witness for Mrs, Napier.
Feb. 15 Had a party to Mr. Willey, 5, Went to Mr. Sanfords funeral. 
25, Bought table spread, warm comfortable weather
Mar, 15 Went to Chicago in a buggy roads perfectly dry and solid have not had any heavy rains this month
16 Ladore trimed cherry trees, 21 Bought Dolly, five years old 
30 Set out thirty cherry trees, 31, Arthur (Gisner) came and stayed all night 
Apr. 9, 10 Heavy rain storm, 8 Clark got home from Michigan 
15 Grass quite green. Gooseberrys and Currents all leaved out, Vegetation two weeks in advance of our seasons generaly 
28 Had pie plant pie,
May, 1 Weather has been very cold for a week past, hard frost every night Minnie Wee had a lamb Mr Hanna gave a lecture to our school
5 Had the first dish of lettuce Strawberries beginning to blossom 
20 An awful thunder storm and more rain fell than in all the July 
19, Had first Gooseberries 27, Phi Perry came to visit us. 
June, 1 Found a ripe strawberry 3 Had a teacup full 5 Dolly had a cold 
8 Had the sheep sheared 21 Girls all picked strawberys to Mr (Pru) 
24 Had first ripe currants for tea
July, 23 Watched with Laura Irish
Aug, 20, Delia got thrown from the buggy had to stay with us all night 
Sep 2 All went to camp meeting 4, Fastest birthday I ever experienced not a leaf stirs 19, Festival at the Gunnisons 
21 Aunt Lucia Irish visited us 25 Went to Etta Lovetts funeral
27 Gathered winter apples

1861
Oct. 2, Girls went to Chicago to see the Wide awakes 
5 Went to the Douglas invincebles Martha Got grave stones for Adela
9 Laura Irish died. was buried the eleventh, Had first frost,
23 Josephine came out and stayed till the second of November 
Nov 5, Had first snow, 9, Clark has not finished digging potatoes 
19, Henry Chapin put blocks. under the house
20 Mr. Clay come to work on our house It Snowed all day 
23, 24 Extremely cold, 25 quite comfortable weather all went up to James,s, unclear a sleigh and had some Michigan apples 
26 Plastered the front room and unclear
Dec 4 Went to Chicago in a sleigh with Mr. Willey
16 We all went to hear Mr. Hannah Preach
21 Anson came, here from St. Louis and made us a visit saturday night we did a candy pull and sunday night went sleigh riding 
1861 Jan 1st Clark Martha and Etta went to Wisconsin first unclear sleighing 
2 Surprise party at John Shermans
4 Folks got home from Wisconsin very cold day
7 All went down to Meachams in a sleigh
10 Mr. (Dressphego) folks came here visiting 
13 All went up to our school house to hear Mr. Hannah preach. tried to have a chicken pie for supper but it was a failure 
14 Mr and Mrs D Clark Matty and myself all went to Chicago in sleigh
15 Dumphees folks started for home I went to Mill  
Feb 1 Excellent sleighing, within the past two weeks we have been to Mr Irish, twice to spend the evening have been spinning stocking yarn, girls go sleigh riding most every night 
10 Snow fast dissapearing Clark Marth and Marietta went in a Cartter to carry Mrs. Vannattas wheel home last of sleighing
25 Heard the first frog sing 
Mar 1 Last day of Mr Millars school
6 Went up to Pessoyers school house to Leycernes went with a four horse team some awful mind holes
11 Girls went to Chicago with Oscar Ada had her likeness taken 
15 Clark got home from West Creek

1861
25 Heard first Robin sing first heavy rain this spring weather been very cold most of the past three weeks 
29 Ada went to the city to visit Josephine bad raing day 
Nov 3 Sowed lettuce & Ada got home from Chicago rain all the way. A. brought news of Mrs Brewsters death 
8 Rain rain very muddy roads in a horrible condition 
15 Has rained nearly every day this week we are cooped up unclear
18 Had three pleasant days sowed Radishes.
29 Got raspberries bushes of Mr. Harris
May 1 Weather very cold afew scattering flakes of snow very hard frost at night
4 Martha and I went to Chicago in buggy went up to <r Brewsters. the roads awful weather wet and cold 
6 Set out currant bushes and they were in blossom 
16 Had first Lettuce apple trees first in blossom 
15 made first Pie plant pie
22 Martha and Clark went to C took Carpet rags 
19 Dolly had a colt and it died the next day
June 4 Ada and I went to C got wall paper
5 Sarah came here visiting had gooseberries stewed 
10 Had the first strawberries and the sheep sheared 
20 Josephine came out here 29 went to Brickton to hear Mr. Hannah lecture in the evening
25 Awful hot dry weather have had no rain in a long time 
29 Ada sent her image to Anson
July 4 Went to Brickton Camp grounds to a Picnic 
8 Heavy showers of thunder and rain
25 Started for Wisconsin weather extremely warm with high south wind very uncomfortable arrived home 
Aug 7 Attended Mary Stysces funeral had an awful storm of thunder and lightening and rain
16 Noble and Elbert started for war
18 Martha and Clark and Marietta went to Rasio to meeting and then to Mr Balls visiting 
19 John Everett called here

1861
21 Paid two dollars to Mr Gunnison for Mr. Hannah 
Aug 11 Mr and Mrs Brewster made us a short visit 
24 Received letters from Marrietta Hrekok which brought us the news of Uncle Clarks death which took place Aug 8st 1861
Sept 4 Celebrated my 45st birthday buy pulling weeds in the garden all the forenoon
14 Ada started for West Creek with Henry Classes folks 
19 Clark and Oscar went to Saint Charles and were sworn in to the service of the United States
19 14 Had threshers the first and last time since we lived here 
18 Clark and Marty got home from Indiana
20 Adaline Mr Robbins and Jo Burns came
26 All went to St Charles to escort the soldiers came home next day 
Oct 12 Martha went in Chicago and stayed till monday to see the Soldiers start for Washington went in monday myself 
8 We all went to Mill and went in the Soldier Camp 
10 Had cider made for the first time
17 Mrs Emerson was buried
Nov 1 Ann Sherman came here to board with us
1 Borrowed $25 of William Willis and paid Michael Nov 2nd
2 Got our fields cleared and our cattle in
8 Weather very mild roads dry as summer
17 Mr Robbins and Jo Burns got back from Town stayed till the 19st took little Jopha home with them an awful cold windy day
20 More comfortable day
21 Clear beautiful day so warm that the Bees were out but rain and thunder at night
23 First snow storm Clark Tarewell and Albert Robbins came here and stayed till the 27 Martha went town with them 
Dec 1 weather very cold and some snow but not enough tounclear sleighing Girls went down to Roses on sled but went pretty unclear

1862
2 Jenny killed. very cold day 
4 Went to Chicago with the beef
6 Very warm bees buzzing about just like summer 
7 Rain and mud ground all thawed out
20 Weather has been very warm for the last two weeks but turned cold last night
24 Very cold girls went to Chicago in sleigh with Mike 
23 Uncle Leonard Perry here stayed until 26 was all the company we had Christmas
29 Brother Leonard Perry and wife made us a call 
Jan 1, 1962 Girls went to Ball to the old Spencer place no sleighing went in wagon
8 Mattie went in town with Mr. Willey in sleigh stayed till 14 came home with Mr Willises folks in buggy sleighing gone except some ice which made an excellent unclear for the fine sleighing which followed , snow fell to the depth of five or six inches the same night and has had several additions unill the present time (Jan 25) sleighing was never better snow being about a foot deep on a level not drifted at all to hurt the roads
21 Mr Clark had his candy Pull
20 Got the Post Office
23 Little Frank Rowley died was buried the 25st 
25 Girls have all gone to Mr. Penayers school house to spelling [[unclear][
Feb 4 Went to Chicago with Delia and James. They went down to Ragons and took the girls to a dance 8 Dumpheys came and went home 11 
Mar 6 went to Town in  cutter with Mrs Naprise the best sleigh ride had this winter
11 Ann Sherman came back 8 Heard first robin 
13 Martha went to Chicago took calves
20 Awful snow storm more snow fell than at any one time this winter mud very deep and unclear unclear deep take them both together and it makes the roads almost impassable

1862
24 Henry Judson came here and stayed till Mar. 30
31 Mr Parry came back from his spree
Apr 11 Ada went to Chicago to make Josephine a visit a very wet time has ruined nearly every day for a fortnight grass begins to look green a little
19 Ada came home walked from Smiths, awful muddy
22 Snow and rain
28 Quite pleasant sowed lettuce seed
29 Sowed Tomatoes seed very pleasant indeed
May 1 - Cattle can first get their living on grass weather fine went in Chicago with Mr Clark
6 Paid George Willey $14 for colt
July 16 Went to Mr Wakeman to get cherries
unclear Ann Sherman married to Benjaman Barslow
Aug 1 Mrs Rogers came to make cheese
27 Went to Chicago to the soldiers Picnic
Sept 6 Paid Booth even dollars
8 Went to Horse Fair
18 Anson and Harrison came here from Vermont brought news of Daniels death they stayed with us till monday 21st
Oct 13 Marietta and I went to Chicago took wool got 54cts per pound
17 Went to Wheaton, Mattie and I
25 Had quite a little flurry of a snow storm
27 Marietta went to Chicago stayed all night with Libby gallup
Nov 1 Got our cattle in the field
10 Went to Chicago with Martha to get Cloaks changed unclear stayed all night at Martha Meachams brought home Billy
unclear Killed hogs
20 Mr Iberson came here and went away the 27
24 Had Flona killed
Dec 1 Martha moved to Chicago
4 Marietta sick with the measles sent for Martha she stayed till the 8 then went back

1863
10 Fredrick Willey came here to stay and do chores
16 Ada went to Chicago to stay
21 Martha came home and took her Turkeys 29 had rain in the evening
24 Very warm bees all out just like spring have had no snow yet of any account 
25 Went round the square called at every house but unclear went to Mr Willeys in the evening muddy rain all night
1863 Jan 1 Got started to go to James to eat New Bear dinner met Mr Ibersons folks and had to come back no snow yet 
4 Weather uncommonly warm
5 Marietta went in Chicago stayed a week and was sick and the girls send for me I went in the 10 and stayed till the 12, we have had no snow yet
15 Had quite a snow storm but drifted so there is no sleighing
29 Went to Chicago Martha came home with me we brought the Melodean and Ada & Etta skates 17 unclear unclear
Feb 15 Weather warm had no sleighing yet quite muddy
23 Chapmans folks moved in our house
Mar 7 Moved the Maner House
13 Martha and I went to Chicago roads quite dry and good
15 John unclear was here
17 Heavy rain roads bad again
19 Had quite a big snow storm
22 Rained hard with thunder and lightening
23 Poor old Cherry died
Apr 1 Chapmans sowed wheat and barley
4 Fred went home to stay
13 Went to Henry Hooners funeral roads dry and good grass beginning to start a little
15 Set Wakemans Cherrie trees and moved gooseberries bush
20 Dolly had a colt it commended raining the 18 and continued crossed through-to pour down wet four four or five days
May 5 Snow storm very cold cherries and currants in bloom
8 Dunpheys folks came Ada commenced school May went to Chicago May 1st

1863
20 Dunpheys folks moved in Chicago. the last week in may was very wet Ada not able to teach school Martha went in her place 
June 1 Cold and very high winds
8 Attended Mrs Moneys funeral
27 Harrison came here
July 1 - Went to Chicago and got Adalines things
8 Harrison and Ada started for Vermont
16 Martha went to Mr Dunlaps and came home 26
Aug 6 Had a little shower, havent had unclear any rain for 2 months
8 9 Had a Busting thunder shower and a good rain
16 Martha and I went to the woods and got over two quarts of blackberries
21 Martha and Marietta went to Chicago Etta had her likeness taken to send to Vermont 29th great frost 
Sept 4 Went to Chicago made myself a birthday present of a PP
5 Delinda and Betsy came out here
6 Homers folks came out to Mr Irishes
7 Had rain in the forenoon
10 Had a fine shower 
16 Went to Chicago with Homers folks staied till the 18
14 Went with Homer and Lucy out to Dunlaps and made cider
16 Went to Chicago with Homers folks staid till the 18
14 Went with Homer and Lucy out to Dunlaps and made cider
Oct 5 Homers and Lucy got back from Minnesota started for Vermont
12 Martha went to Dunlaps to stay while Mrs Dunlap goes south
23 Went to David Robinsons funeral
22 Had snow storm two inches deep
29 Rained so hard the girls could not go to Ann Barstows quilting
30 Had another snow storm
Nov 6 Ada got to Chicago from Vermont got home the 10
20 Ada and I went to Town with Mr. Chapman
Dec 8 Girls have gone to Noble Tarishes to a dance the weather has been very mild for  two weeks past
14 Cold with snow and rain Martha gone to C with Dunlaps
27 Rain sleighing most spoiled
31 The coldest weather we ever knew and an awful snow storm a great many people and animals froze to death we were all at Ragors Hotel

1864
Jan 1 The coldest New Years day I ever saw
6 the weather continues cold has not showed any on the north window since the last of December have not had our mail for the last two times it was due
12, 13 Weather comfortable Martha and Tavent up to Saraho and Mrs Govanto
20 All went to the Town House to Ball
23 Ada and I went to Chicago on a load a hay with Mike I stayed till the 27 great thaw all mud snow nearly all gone 25 went to the Theatre with J E
Feb 9 Martha and I went to Chicago with Joe he took hogs and eggs got 50 ct a dozen weather clear and cold no snow
Mar 2nd All went to the Town to a ball, roads pretty good and weather comfortable.
16 All went up to Ben's to eat sugar.
21 Girls went to Dick Locker sugar party.
24 Martha and I went to Chicago and she started for West Creek
Apr. 16 Martha got home from Indiana stopped at Henry Klasses and saw Noble Irish married. Snow squable all day.
May 6 Luther Pierce and Henry Benson came from VT
17 Marvin Chapin killed near Lookout mountain
July 4 Went to Jefferson picnic, had new potatoes
16-17-18-19 Had an awful rain. filled the slough full of water. 
24 Ada Martha and myself went to Brickton to Church for the first time in two years
Aug. 13. Went to John [Thermore] funeral which was held in the grove near Booker school house.
24 Camp Meeting commenced. some of our folks went every day for five days with Dolly Emma and Josephine came out.
Sept 1st Mrs. Sherman was buried today. (old lady)
17 Melinda Pierce and Sophronia came here
21 Henry Benson came here from Dryden unclear and the Leydin boys all got home from the war.
22 Martha went to Mr Dunlaps and she and I went to Chicago

1865
Oct. 5. Helen died was burried on the seventh.
1st Ada taken sick with typhoid fever. Ada began to get a little better and has continued to improve slowly up to the present time.. 26th
26. Mr Napier. Fred Willey and Laura all sick.
27. Etta and I w3ent to Harlem.
28 Clark started for West Creek.
Nov. 2. Jofa and Tommy came here
11 Quite a snow storm.
30. Lucy married. quite a pleasant day. married to Versima
Dec 7 Snow fell about three or four inches deep. but the road is so rough that sleighing is not good
3 Ada rode over to Williams to see the bride. 4 she went to Willeys for the first-time in eight-weeks.
13. Killed our pigs. they were seven months and nine days old. 200lbs.
17 Clark Ada and I went down to Harlem.
24. Libbie and George, Dunphey. Emma and little George came out to spend Christmas with us.
25 Went to Henry Emersons funeral in a sleigh.
26 Went to Chicago to carry Dunpheys back
28 Girls. Mat and Add went to Town House to Ball sleighing poor
1865. Jan 1st Girls and boys went sleighriding on the river
2 Went to Ragors to a ball. Mr Ewdarda came out here very mild and pleasant day.
9 Martha and I went to Harlem got the deed to the lot
12 All went to Town House to ball.
27 Ball to Ragors Mr. P. there.
29 Went to Brickton Church in sleigh.
Feb. 1st Girls went to Orlando Algers to surprise party .
Mar. 11. Clark and girls went to Booker in a sleigh.
12 Snow all went off . hail. awful day
27. Have had pleasant weather a few days roads getting quite dry.
Apr 1st Dunphey came out here on foot looking for George who had run away. he walked back again same night.

1865
3 Martha, Etta, and I went to Chicago. Richmond taken 
8  Quite cold frozen ice quite thick and frost on window
10 Lee and his army surrendered to our forces. 
14 Our great and good president Abraham Lincoln shot. Died April the fifteenth.
23 Attended the President's funeral at Brickton. The weather cold with a little snow yesterday morning. the 22.
May 1st. All went to Chicago to see the dead President
2 Ada commenced her school. 
12. Party at Klasses. for the benefit of Sanitary fair
25 Mother Evirels came here and stayed till the 30th 
31 Martha and Etta went to Sanitary fair
June 4 Have not had any rain since May 27. getting pretty dry
5 Went to the great Sanitary fair weather very hot and dry
9 Had a most glorious rain
6 Bought three silver spoons.
16 George Dunphey came out. Matty and Etty went to the fair
20 All went to Ann Barstows quilting
July 4 Went to Chicago to see fireworks
8 Sherman Jondson and Lucy Brurter came out here it commenced to rain and continued till the 11th
13 Martha and Clark went to Chicago took currants.
19 All went to Sr George's picnic very pleasant day 
24. Went in Chicago. came home in the rain. It has rained almost every day for a fortnight
31. Tommy and Jofa came out here
Aug 1st. Clear beautiful day Ada has gone home with Jofa
6 Went in Chicago to stay with Aunt Libbie as she is sick
9 Had the awfulest rain that ever was.
11 Had my ambrotype taken was most 49 years old
20 Rain and pretty hard wind
23 Camp meeting commenced Jofa came out 26, 
Sept 1st Mtta went to Chicago to see Emma I stayed until the 4th
5 girls all went to Henry Class's to party
12 James Knott died
13 got Ada empress cloth dress and Mtta Alpacca

1865
19 Went up to Mrs Higgins's to quilting 24 cracking thunder shower 
18 Martha went to Chicago got her Alpacca dress and gray Poplin for me
25 Made Cider Oct 2 Ada went to Chicago to help Dunphys folks move in their new house - went to concert to opera house
Oct 15 weather still continues fine have not had frost enough to kill tobacco 12 All went to Ellen Class's to quilting
Oct 20 Started for Ind got there 21 got to Chicago 24 snow storm that night
Oct 9 Noble Irish died, but they did not get the news until last of the month 
Nov 17 George Willey got home from New Hampshire
" 26 Went to hear sermon preached on the death of Noble Irish
28 Clark and George Goodier went to Camp Douglass to tear down the building they bought snowed when they started 
Dec 5th Mr Hasbrouck commenced school
" 2st Mr Irish had his sale previous to leaving for Vt
" 7th Thanksgiving clear and pleasant but pretty cold wind
" 11th to 14th weather very cold but no snow
" 16 Clark bought his black coat 
" 23 Aunt Libby and Emma came out to spend Christmas
" 26 girls all went to Jefferson to ball last night
" 28 Ada and Emma went to Town House to ball Mtta sick could not go 1866
Jan 1st Mr Shaw came out and they all went to Ragars to ball no snow yet
" 16 We have had rain, hail, sleet, snow, wind, and everything in the shape of weather since I wrote last and taking it all together a sleigh will slip along very well but one warm day would spoil it all
" 17 Ada and Margaret went to Chicago with Clark on sled
" 18 All went to Mr. Place's to see Frank Tanner he is very sick 
" 22 Went to Ben Barstows 21 went to Spelling school to Smith's
" 23 girls went sleigh riding 24 All went to Henry Lovetts
" 24 Monick Knott married - 25 Ada and Ett went to Niles to oyster supper 
" 26 All went to Brickton to meeting  27 went to Ed Algars has been splendid sleighing for two week
29 All went to Town House to good Templars meeting
30 Ada and Mtta went to Alvin Leatt's to party Mrs Chapman's baby born

1866
Feb 1st Ada and Etta went to Town House to good Templars meeting
" 9 Edward and Jopha came out here 12 All went to Harlem
" 13 snow storm 14th snow drifting badly
" 15-16 coldest weather of the season very cold
18 went to Chicago took Josie home
20th Ada went to Chicago skating Park 21--22--thawing 
24-25 freezing hard - 26th great skate on our slough 40 persons there weather mild beautiful moonlight 28 thaw skating spoiled
March 6 Went to Mrs Williamsons funeral
" 14th last day of Hasbrouck's school
" 15. Martha and I went to Chicago on cars from Harlem came home next day with Clark almost froze
" 20th Clark and Martha moved to Harlem it rained. hailed froze thawed thundered and was a perfectly awful day that night Curly had a lamb and it died next day
" 24th snowed most all day Clark and Martha came home 
25 cold as Greenland
April 1st Martha came home and I went back to Harlem roads awful had hard thunder shower that night
" 2d-3d weather warm 6th cold froze hard 11th sowed lettuce
" 18 Marietta went to Harlem on horseback
24 Just finished housecleaning cattle nearly get their bearing on grass
May 10th Clark took cows to Harlem 9th Thomy came out and brought white Pony
13th clear but very cool day feel lonesome first sunday Martha has not been home
May 14 Went down to Harlem and went to Chicago with Eli on waggon staid till 19 came back on cars
May 22d Ada went to Chicago to attend Maggie Johnsons wedding
28 Ada commenced school in Robinson District
June 2d Marietta and I went to Chicago in Buggy by Harlem came back same day
June 9th has rained almost every day for for the last two weeks
10 Lucy and Ed came out here and took Tomy home with last time we ever saw him Lucy got her arm broken going home--Mr Hasbrouk two Chittendern's, Emma Dunphey all here they all went to Harlem to ride
17th All went to german camp meeting

1866
July 18 Marietta and I took currants to Chicago got three dollars and a quarter a bushel 24th took 70 lbs wool got only 31 cts per lb
29 George Goodier married
Aug 1st Ann Barstow here visiting-rain and thunder
" 11 Awful big rain whole prairie covered with water immense quantity of hay and grain spoiled almost as bad a time as it was last year at this time we had about 8 tons down 
18th All went to Mrs. Brook's to quilting
22 Camp meeting commenced 
Sept 3d Mtta went to Harlem to school
" 4th awful rain, it poured in perfect torrentz very dismal  birth day have been sick four day's -- 8th heard of Aunt Clara's death which took place Aug 13th 1866--Tomy Brewster died the 8th of Sept
25th we have had an awful rainy wet time Ada's school closed the 18th Mrs Huett died the 22 Sept 1866
29th Oscar and Lucy came out and stayed all night with us 
30th Went to Frank Tanners funeral to Bricton clear beautiful day 
Oct 15 have had nearly three weeks very pleasant weather have just heard that Emma Huett died this morning and Margarett Willey very sick with Cholira
18th Ad went down to Harlem and Martha came home to stay with me until they get the house plastered
23d It is awful cold for this time of year and snows some
Nov 2d Etta and I went to Chicago to stay all night and found Mr Brewster sick with somthing resembling Cholera--
Nov 21 snows a little getting cold very fast Mr Willey took Post Office 29 Ada and I went to Harlem to spend Thanksgiving pretty cold and uncomfortable
Dec 1st 2d clear fine days and not very cold--8-9. very cold
" 19th quite a big snow storm 10th & 11th coldest days 13th Martha came home and stayed till the 18th her birth day poor child it was a sorry birth day it shows she is born to trouble
Dec 25 Clark and Martha, Mattie, K and Mr Thaw came to spend Christmas with us they did not go to any ball were all disappointed the weather was quite comfortable but no sleighing
26-27-28-extremely cold weather.

1867
Jan 1st All went to Jefferson to ball went in waggon pretty cold
10 Ada and H went to Brooks to Picnic ball have had several flurries of snow but not enough to make good sleighing
12 we all went to Harlem sleighriding
17 Walter and Ett went to Chicago and brought Em home with them and they went up to gillispies to ball 
23 went to Wm Willis's funeral 24th Tuck Moody came here on a visit
25 had big snow storm 30th more snow good sleighing
28 All went to Jo Toats for evening visit awful cold
Feb 2d Hasbrouck and I went down to Harlem and stayed all night and Martha came home with us
5 I went home with Martha and she and I went to Talman's to see the good Templars dance weather cold and rather too much snow to be good sleighing 9th & 10 very cold
12 it is thawing very fast Hasbrouck gone to Breton to lecture
13th-14th very cold Thermometer 8 degrees below zero - plenty snow 
March 19th Mr Barty's folks moved here
20th roads quite passible considerable snow on ground 
26 Another snow storm had cold weather nearly all this month
27th Mr Willey went to Jefferson in sleigh
28th We moved to Harlem roads not very bad
Apr 1st First spring like day very pleasant 
2d heard first prairie hen 3d first frog
6th snow storm 10th Hasbrouck came here to board
8th Ella had Photograph taken for Mr Tay 9th she went to Chicago to visit Emma stayed till the 16th
18 Martha and Mary Robins went to Chicago weather quite warm but mudholes so bad we cannot go up home 
27th cold and backward flurry of snow
28th one month gone and we have not bee up home yet
30th went home May 1st & 2d cold 3d hard freeze
May 4th Rained nearly all day 8th Clark set fruit trees
15 Went to Chicago to stay with Sister Libby she was sick
20th Hasbrouck left here 7th Church at Leyden organized 
21-22 awful cold rain storm the worst I ever saw this time of year the poor cattle suffer awfully they had to let them go without being milked and they ran off to the woods for shelter

1867
May 26 First pleasant sunday in this month
27-28-29 rain rain rain -- 27 Emma came out to make her farewell visit before she is Mrs Chittenden
30th Martha and I went up home and took baby going pretty bad the orchard and garden looked beautiful made me most homesick the season is unusually backward Mr Barty commenced planting corn June 10t no one in the neighborhood had planted their corn yet rains about every other day - June 1st Josephine came out to Harlem stayed two nights 
June 16 All attended Emma Dunphy wedding clear beautiful day 
22d Had a cracking thunder shower Dolly got badly hurt 
24 I went up home and got gooseberries 28th Ada and I went home and picked gooseberries and cherries - 30 Went to Warswick to get strawberries 
July 4th girls went to Jefferson to a ball 6th Martha and I picked cherries
8th Lura and Lucy came down here and it rained so they could not go home stayed all night - 18 St George's Picnic 
19 Oscar and Lucy came out here 20 Martha and I went home to pick currants stayed a week very hot weather
Aug 1st girls went home to stay a while and went to Picnic weather very dry rain needed badly 12 had a slight shower 
Aug 14 girls came home from Leyden awful hot weather - baby sick 
17 Went to Chicago got Martha window blinds and box peaches weather continues hot and dry 22d took girls home to go to camp meeting
Sept 19 Ada and I went to george Dunlaps
Sept 23 Went up home to spin stayed till 27
Sept 28 Went to Austin to sell books but did not sell any
Oct 12 Ada and Ett went to Brickton to visit Emma Chittenden
Oct 13 have not had frost hard enough to kill tomatoes vines yet 
" 18 Mr gunnison made us a short visit

1867
Oct 23d Mr Hasbrouck taken to Leyden from Chicago very sick with Typhoid fever
27 Martha and I went to Mr Brooks to get cider got it for 15 cts 
Nov 10 Martha and I went up to Chapmans and took baby Rena
Nov 21 Ada and I went to fair 28th first snow storm have had no rain this fall the wells and cisterns are nearly dry they have to go to the Oplain river from Jefferson - gales ridgee all unclear
Dec 29th Ada and Ett went Jefferson to Christmas ball with M Pratt and R Outhet Sister Delia came same day 
28 she and the girls went up to Leyden road awful rough snow all gone 
1868 Delia and girls came back New years day Maggie with them we all went over to Mr Timmies in the evening had a real jolly time Jan 4 I went in Town with Delia
Jan 9th Ada and Ett went up to Mr Layres to a party 
Feb 4th Martha and I went to george goodier most of the way on the river sleiging very fine 
8 had a grand old snow storm we have had steady cold weather for nearly six weeks
Feb 15 commenced thawing and kept on until the 19th the snow is all off and the weather is just like spring - last Friday Ada went to a party in Chicago with Jim Bowman the last day of Feb I went Chicago to see Dr Foote also went to see Clark where he was keeping back with his cows
March came in howling and we had the worst snow storm of the season but the wind blowed it all in heap 
6th and 7th it rained hard and melted the snow all off and made a perfect flood 10th Ell went to Chicago with L W to theatre 16th very hot day at night had a awful wind blew down a good many houses in Chicago killed one woman rained and thundered

1868
March 19 very cold 23 another hot day
22 Perry and Laura Hi Beauman and B unclear here
24 cold rain with sleet with high wind 
26-29 still continues cold 26th Clark came home with his cows
April 1-2-3 pretty cool weather 4th snow storm 3 or 4 inches deep 
12th weather has been cold the past week ground frozen hard and yesterday had another snow storm (baby can creep across the floor
Apr 18th first warm pleasant day we have had this month 
Apr 27 Ada commenced her school in Drapers districts
" 28 Willey Barty buried May 3d had a cracking thunder shower Jim and Hi Beauman here 8th Ada and I started for Harlem road so bad could get no farther than Mr Layer had to stay there all night have had cold rainy weather the past week
May 11 fine day planted most of our garden Ada and I horse been making picket fence at odd times this past week
13th Another cold mean rain right from unclear
14-15 - more rain 16 warm pleasant day
24 Ell went to Leyden to stay with Ada
30 Mrs Smoke Em unclear and Martha went to Leyden
June 6 Hi and Rube came out here 14th very hot 
20 cold as greenland Lucy unclear came out here
July 4th awful hot day Ada went to Jefferson to ball had the last unclear strawberries and first from cherries some new potatoes and peas 7th Martha and I went to pick
10th Clark and Martha went and finished them
19th we have had awful hot weather for two weeks past and a great many unclear city have had with heat
22 Clark was taken sick  24 Ada and I went to Leyden

1868
went to Rolfers, Colsy's, Fred Brooks's, Ann Barstows, Mrs Tanners, and home again 
July 29th Ada and I went to Leyden and picked the last of our currants and Cherries when we got back to Harlem found Clark very sick
Aug 2d was a dreadful day for us all poor Clark breathed his last at twenty minutes past five O how he suffered the last two days God grant that we may never be called to pass through another such a scene the 4th he was buried and the unclear Oscar and Lucy came out to see us and sympathize with us in our trouble 12th Josephine came out and Mrs. Layr and Mary was here Aug 16th we all went to Leyden to attend the dedication of the new Church very pleasant day 
Aug 27 Ada Ett and I went to Camp meeting 
25 Emma Chittenden came out here and stayed till the 29 Mr Seymour and Allen came here to board the 27
Sept 13 Went to Austin to see Mrs Barden
" 12 Ada and I went to Chicago she bought black Alpacca for herself and Ett dresses 16th had Auction sale of cows 
Oct 5 Arba Tanner came to finish Marthas barn Mrs Gazley came with him brought the news of Martha Brooks death
6th Ell and I went home to dig our potatoes 
Sept 29 took a trip out to Elgin had a very good visit to Mr John Knott, and found my old friend Mary Crogan Hiatt stayed three days in Elgin and one night at the Junction with Lydia Foster 
Oct 22d Festival at Leyden for the first time 
Oct 25 Went to Leyden to church roads fine

1868
Nov 5th Martha and Ed Beaver went to Leyden and got six cherry trees 
"14 Ada and I went to Chicago and got cloth for her cloak and Ettas plaid drefs
Nov 20th Poor curly was killed by the dogs
"26 Thanksgiving Mr Allen and Mr Warswick and Mr Zimmerman were here to dinner had turkey and all the usual accompaniments and Oysters for supper and at night the girls went to Chicago to see Edwin Booth play
Dec 1st snow storm but the wind has blown it all away 
" 13 have had very cold weather the past week sleighing good - Dec 6th Hi and Rube and Willeys folks all here for sleighride
1869
Jan 1st Heavy snow storm drifted pretty bad
3d Hi and Rube out here commenced thawing 
5th sleighing all spoiled 8th rained all day
9th turned cold and froze all up again 
25th weather very fine no sleighing Etta and I went to Leyden yesterday (24) in Buggy road dry except where the old snow banks were 20th Martha went to Chicago to hear Fowler lecture 31 clear beautiful day never knew a Jan with so little cold weather 
Feb 6th Mr Steele Mr Seales Mr Jim Walter and the girls all went up to Willeys in sleigh 
11th I went to Chicago to womans convention heard Anna Dickinson all mud and slush 
28 Mr Seales Mr Warswick and the girls went to Leyden to church in sleigh weather has been pretty cold all the week

1869
March 1st Martha and I went to Leyden in sleigh very poor sleighing 11th have had pretty cold weather all this month
15 very cold - 31 very cold with snow squalls--
Apr 1st very cold with rain hail snow and blow froze real hard at night
Apr 9th Benjamin Irish came here
17th Martha went to Leyden to help Sarah papar
18th worst old storm of the season an immens amount of rain fell girls had an awful time getting home from Leyden they had been to take Mira home

15th Herman came down here after fence boards
25 real hot day Mr and Mrs Robins and Matilda came here 26 cold as greenland
27-28 rain rain rain 
June 4th Ada and I went to Chicago stayed all night awful hot when we went an awful cold when we come home
June 6th Mike came down and brought Kitty for Linda
" 12th Rena sick in the night had a fit
23 Ellison took Kitty to try her 
27 It has rained every day but one for more than a week it is awful wet the roads so bad cannot get to Leyden
29 Martha and Ett went to Chicago and stayed all night at Mulligan's

3d more rain roads perfectly awful have not been to Leyden in two months

15 froze up again 16 I was taken sick with very bad cold 18th Etta sick the same way 19 Martha sick too very cold weather very cold

7-8-9 very cold. 10th commence thawing 11-12  heavy rain
14th-15th Ice storms 16 rain wind-and heavy thunder 
17th coldest weather of the season
30 small snow storm

28 Seales came home from Logansport

12 Worst snow storm of the season
15th another big snow and so cold Seales froze his ears going to the Post Office 19th thawing

Apr 1st clear beautiful day the first pleasant sunday since Aunt M has been here
4th Warswick left 15th had quite a snow storm
25 Went to Chicago to make out papers to Lawrence Goodier Bought our front  room carpet
29 Matilda Ella Farewell and Aunt Libby came out here May 4th Etta and I  went to Chicago and got chairs and my black Alpacca drefs 8th Aunt M and I went to Leyden cherry trees all in bloom

1870
May 10th cattle have been getting their living for nearly three week
" 11th Aunt M and I started for Minnesota arrived at Lake City 12th in the afternoon 15th had Hail storm very hot weather vegitation more forward there than it was at home currant nearly as large as peas maple leaves nearly full size lilac in full bloom
17 Went out to James's quite cool had to wear cloak but had a delightful ride admiring the romantic and beautiful scenery of Minn 18 Anson went home 
19th rains - 20th rain hail and thunder 21st rain hail and the most dreadful thunder I ever heard the wind blew hard and rain poured down in perfect torrents 
22 High winds with more rain and thunder 
27 Delia and I visited Mrs Osborne
29 Went back to Lake City 31 the last day of May Lavina picked a sauce dish full of ripe strawberries for me
June 3d all had strawberries for supper
" 4th Anson Aunt M. Alice gracie and myself all went up the Lake shore for a ride to Frontenac a delightful place about 8 miles from Lake City
5 Went to Episcopal Church - very dry - would feel more devotional in Frontenac under the beautiful trees 
June 7th Bid adieu to Lake city and all the dear friend and started for home arrived at La crosse next morning at 8 o clock had to stay there all day got to Chicago the next morning at ten and home at 4 P.M.
June 22 My darling Etta was married and started for Logansport very hot dry weather grass all drying up

1870
June 28 Had a glorious rain the first we have had since I got home and a long time before
July 12 Martha and I went to Leyden to finish picking currants and went to Mr Penoyers to see about getting lot 
26 Went to Mr Penoyers and bought lot awful hot weather Perry Tanner very sick [marked through-Aug 1st went to rivers]
Aug 2d Martha signed the Mortgage to Mr Trettestrong 
" 4th Went to Chicago to get Money to build our house 
" 7th Will went to Chicago and bought the lumber 
"8th Sam and Etta went to carry Perry Tanner home

28 Peltons barn burned and Lindon's horses and mules 
Sept 1st had house insured 2d got lightening rod 
17 bought cistern 19 Martha went to Leyden to gather apples 28 commenced to rain and kept on two days more rain than we have had since last spring 
Oct 8th Perry Tanner came here
Oct 5 Ada and went to Drapers and made cider
" 13 Ada and I went to Leyden to festival 
15th have not had frost hard enough to kill cucumber or tomato vines
16 rained all day were disappointed in not hearing Mr Fowler preach at Thatchs
19 Sam and his men went up to paint Mr Willeys house Martha went too and brought back load of Pumpkins and Mrs Willey
24 Went to Leyden and Mike came down here and brought all our pumpkins 25 had rain 
26th Etta moved in the new house, she has left her home forever, probably, o how we shall miss her bright face and cheery voice-----

1870
Oct 28 I blundered into the new cistern and most broke my neck - Nov 1st Martha painted her middle room floor 
9 Sam got his colt George Newell and Aunt Lizzie came out here 
12th Sam and Ett went to Town with his colt for the first time
24 Mr Slunn presented us with a turkey for Thanksgiving Sam and Etta took dinner with us and then went for a ride up to Leyden and brought Mira Willey home with them and they all went to a dance
27 Clear. still. beautiful day more like spring than fall Margarette and Mike came down here and I went home with Mike and staid untill the 30th 29 Mr Teed came here to board
Dec 19 snow storm if fell about six inches deep  From 20th to 24 weather extremely cold thermometer ranged from 6-16 -- 25 a little more mild we all took dinner with Ett had turkey presented by Mr Steiner mince pie pumpkin pie fruit cake cranberry sauce and various other things and finished off with Oyster supper how little did we think one year ago that we should eat Christmas dinner in a new house and Ett would be a married woman keeping house wonder what change will be made in our circumstances by another Christmas it may be a great mercy that it is hidden from us we ought to be very thankful and happy that we are permitted to be together and are all in comfortable health - it is evening and it has commenced storming the wind blows hard 
29 weather quite comfortable was much surprised by a visit from Mr Hasbrouck stayed all night with us 
30 Martha went to Chicago spent New Year at Pelton's

19 Aunt Lizzie came out in a sleigh with Sam and stayed

6 Rained nearly all day all had to stay home from church
7-8-9 cold and stormy snow and sleet
10th I went to Chicago to find boarding place for Etta but did not find one called at Newell's-Dunphey-Brewster and went to courthouse to finish paying Taxes
11th-12th stormy and cold 13th mild pleasant day (Easter sun) Fred came down after Laura roads awful muddy
Apr 8th Etta came home and Sam and Arthur went to board Harlem house 
16th cold damp day Lindon hauled lumber for my fence 
20th It has been cloudy and stormy for a week past roads awful bad 
21 Another snow storm - went off to Jasper when I got home found Alonzo and Albert building fence
24 Ada went to Town to get her teeth fixed took Rena with her stayed all night at Dunphys 
22 Uncle Oscar came out here the first time after his return home from Europe 
27 very pleasant mild day
29 August Smith worked for me moved currant bushes and briars
May 1st Mary Kettlestrings wedding day rained all day wound up with thunder lightning and hail - Ada went to the wedding with Will Warswick Josiphine came here from Wheaton and stayed all night 
2d more rain in evening Mr Lenox sister came

1873
May 6th Martha and I went to Chicago and found rooms for Etta Mr Brewster came out and concluded the bargain with Mr Kenedy 
8th August Smith dug up our old blackberry briers
10th Etta moved to Chicago to 1411 State Street. Laura came out here 
14 Ada went to Chicago to stay with Etta Fred came after Laura awful cold for May weather 15th cold the 5th turned old Brin out up the yard for the first time fed her hay until the 12th 
18 Dunphys and Chittendens came out here staid all night and Dunphy three or four day
20th current bushes just in blossom cherries not in bloom yet 
21 I went to Chicago with Etta and staid until the 24th
22 they had the awful Tornado in Iowa
26 Ada went in Town to stay with Etta - 28 had lettuce for supper
27 Uncle Oscars folks moved to Oak Park - Doll ran away to Leyden
30 turned awful cold and had a hard thunder shower 
31 Ada and Etta came home from Town - Martha papered her kitchen 
June 1st very fine day Sam and Arthur went to Leyden after Kitty 
4th Martha went to Town with Etta and staid two nights
6th Ada went to Chicago to stay with Etta 
11 I went in Town and staid all night with Ada at Hospital
17 was sent for to go and stay with her at Etta staid untill the 25th very hot dry weather 
15th Put Brin in Mr Quicks pasture
26 Mrs Napier came down here and stayed until 29th 
28th Ada got home from Chicago 
July 4th has has been an awful day rained most of the day thundered and wind blew our folks did not know what to do with themselves as they were disappointed about going in the woods for Pic nic finally all went over to Patterson's to eat their dinner and carouse there and poor little Leo died so she will never trot around with me any more

1873
5th Rena and I buried little Leo in the North East corner of our garden
6th Albert and I picked Cherries off Niles trees
8 Etta moved home from Chicago 9th & 10th very cool weather most cold enough for frost have had a good deal of rain for the last two weeks had string beans the 8th planted 20 May 
20 Mr and Mrs Patterson and all our folks went in the woods down by Mannings and took dinner - wrote a letter to Mrs. Mc Comber telling about Leo
25 went in the woods to Episcopal Pic-nic - got Doll home the 19th 31 heavy rain
Aug 2d Miss Blake came out here and stayed over Sunday - Aunt Libbie came down 
Aug 7 Sister Dunphy Ada Rena and I went to Lucy Kersimery and to the Insane Asylum 4 went to Chicago to meet Mrs Smith to get Abstract
Aug 9 Shafe hauled my hay 11 Sister David I went to Bricton to see Em but they had moved to Chicago (she went home the 13th) and so we came back and staid to Mr Willeys
14 Martha and Ada went to Leyden to make their farewell visit before jumping out of the frying pan into the fire stayed until the 17th when Sam and Ell Carbell and Josie went up to Mr Willey's to come home with them 
19th Will and Martha Rena all went to Barnums show awful hot 
21 Corbett and Ada went to the show 
22 Josies birth day she had all our folks over there to supper 
24 went to Chicago also the 26 and 28 to settle Abstract Acct
29 I went to Newells on Van Buren street got Etta music book for birth day present 
30 got the ballance of money due me from smiths
Sept 1st awful hot day - 2d Alonzos folks moved to Chicago
3d Ada and I went to Town and stayed all night at Hickoks she got her black silk dress - shawl - water proof blankets - and unclear
Sept 7th Martha and I went to Leyden to get butter 8th Margarett came down and the 9th we quilted one of Adas bed quilts - 11 got my silver burned got 25 dollars from Smith - Arthur got castor for Ada 
13 had quite hard frost

1873
Sept 15 Arthur stated for Winona - 20th Martha went to Chicago got Thimble and silver cup for Ada and Etta got book for Corbeth
21 clear beautiful day perhaps the last Sabbath we shall all be together
24th Ada was married and left us for the protection of another, left us to make her home among strangers, O how lonely and desolate our home, and it rained hard all the afternoon was a miserable gloomy day to us, and presume it was to her 
25th clear and cool Sister D and I took a ride to West Maywood 
26-27 hot Thermometer 86 - 28 rained all day
Oct 2d I went to Chicago 3 rained all day - 4th Harrison came here 
7 I went to Chicago with Harrison 8 we went to the Exposition 
9th came home 10th we went to the woods to get nuts but was too late nuts all gone
11 Martha and I went to Chicago and she bought her wedding dress 
14 Mrs Moyer sewed for Martha 12 Martha and I went to Leyden
14 Sister D came out here and stayed until after Marthas wedding which took place Oct 16 - 16-17 both cloudy-misty days
17 Will and Martha went to the Exposition
19 Martha and I went up to Mrs Sayres to see Mary and John
Oct 23 Sam and Etta left us to start for old England I went in Town with them and saw them off on the cars in the darkness stayed all night at Sister Ds came home the next day and O what a blank what desolation in our home - for was she not the light of our household the fret of us all in her childhood, our comfort in her woman hood how can we stand it almost a year and not see her cheerful face nor hear her merry voice what a silent lonely house we shall have with no music no laughter, and only the little Rena to make a noise for us 
Oct 27 first snow storm of the season 29 more snow and every appearance of winter 30 more snow but melts as fast as it falls kitchen plastered the 24 and 25 of Oct

1873
Nov 1st Clear pleasant weather Margaret came and stayed all night had three tons coal hauled
2d Misty drizly in forenoon pleasant afternoon Martha and Will went down to Warswick's 3d Martha whitewashed and painted kitchen
4th very warm children at play out doors bareheaded Mr Kenedy had Doll to go to Chicago to carry plants
5-6-7-8 comfortable nice weather 9th got news that the Scotia had arrived
10th Martha went to Town got wall paper for bedroom
11 awful cold raw wind 12 a little snow very cold 
13th more comfortable 15 very warm - Martha painted kitchen floor 
16 warm nice day Martha Rena and I went down to Money's
17th went to white church to hear Armstrong read turned cold snowed before morning 
18th cold 19th colder 20th coldest - got moved back in kitchen four weeks after Etta went away 
22 Mild pleasant day made floor in cow stable
23 rainy - stormy - day 27th Thanksgiving day all went to Aunt Lucys to Oyster supper 28 awful cold miserable day 
29 very mild-pleasant and comfortable 30th Ds 
Dec 1st 2d 3d misty-warm-and rainy turned cold at night and had a terrible blow snow all gone - 4th Unity Church festival
6th Went to Chicago to get money to send to Sam - more snow
10th Barnard left Sam's house - dull chilly day 
22 weather has been mild and comfortable the last week 
29 Went to Baptist Church to hear Mr goodspeed preach but Mr Emory (Em Crandoll husband) was sent instead
1874
Jan 1st We all went to Leyden intending to eat our New years Will Martha Rena and I dinner at Wma's but as they had gone to Lucy's we went to Hemans stayed there awhile had dinner then went around to Mr Willeys and mad a short call it was a very mild comfortable day but quite muddy coming home -

1874
Jan - 2d 3d warm comfortable days 3d we cleaned chamber and it was warm enough without fire but the 4th it turned cold and snowed and blowed but I went to the Methodist Church Dedication at night it was very cold Laura came 5th clear and cold - 
6th-7th- very fine mild damp - 8th Laura went home in the eve went to hear Bishop Cheeney preach 12th weather continues mild went to hear Mrs Rayne lecture 
15th Coldest day of the season Thermometer 5 degrees below zero we went to Amity Church dramatic performance 
16th not quite so cold - 17th Poor Kitty (Sam's horse) died - 
18 dull gloomy day rained a little hailed a little and is now snowing Rena Swartz buried to day 
21 went to Chicago to pay taxes rained all day 
22 Mrs Hickok and I went to Mr Dunphys I stayed all night
23 went down Town stoped to Hickoks to dinner then she and I called to see Mrs Kenedy stoped awhile to Mr Edwards, went back to Dunphys and stayed all night it turned real cold and snowed 24 went to see Barnard but could get nothing from him - 26th weather mild again 
27-28 - heavy rain cistern's all running over full - 
29th colder 30th quite a snow storm 
Feb 1st cold raw day snow at night 2d Mrs Willey came in sleigh 
5th Fred Margaret and Mira came down after Mrs Willey 
7th Mrs Willey and I went to see the Teak Sisters
10th Snow all gone weather very mild Arthur left the car shop and went to work for Bates
14 Josie and I went to hear the Tennesean's sing Martha and I went to Chicago and she got her sheeting

1874
15 I went to Unity Church, for a long time and had not been had the contribution box thrust under my nose the first thing 
19 Mrs Kent died 18 Sewing Society met at our house for the first time
21 went to Chicago to get draft for Sam stayed until 23 turned very cold and remained cold until the 27
28 Martha went to Chicago went to Matilda Mulligans she was not at home she came back and stayed at Hickoks
March 1st Cloudy dull day 2d warm and windy Old Brin had a calf we all went to Unity Church Tom foolery - 
3d It rained and thundered and then turned cold at night and blew a perfect gale
6th thunder shower with high wind - 8 cold with very high wind 
13th has been cold all the week - last night I watched with Mrs Money 
15 warm pleasant day Josie and I went down to Money
16 sowed lettuce 17 Lenox moved in Town last week we made two comfortors and covered a quilt 
19 Went to Mr Hemingways paid tax on Adas lots
20 Clear beautiful day Alonzo and Marietta came here from Marengo Rena went to bed alone for the first time in kitchen chamber 
22d-23d weather cold freezes hard nights Rena commenced going to School she is seven years old today Martha made her a frosted cake
26 Martha Rena and I went to the Methodist festival 
27 Sister Dunphy moved out here 
April 2 Went to Chicago to send draft to Sam called to see Mrs Everette and Mrs Pelton stayed all night at Hickok
5th Regular old snow storm 7th Martha and Sister D went to Chicago took Rena to see Flora and also had her likeness taken 
12th we have had cold weather all the week past and last night it froze water in the kitchen that was warm when we went to bed Martha and Will went to Thomas to celebrate his birth day

1874
April 17th Josie and I went up to Smith to see about currant bushes cold winds road dry and good after we got home Martha and went to Mrs Porters Benedicts goodrows Furbees and Crandel's
18 warm comfortable days Money made fence
21 Lee whitewashed Lenox house 22 Set cherry trees on Lenox lot 
25 Went to Chicago and finished paying taxes and paid one hundred dollars to Du Vernot agent of Cunard Steamship line to send to New York for Sam -  
26 Went up to Leyden and got currant bushes found Mr Willey pretty sick
28 Julia Knott came here from Kansas 
29 painted Lenox kitchen
May 1st I went to Chicago to find Sister Dunphy Mr Paine moved in my house Money worked for me 30th of April got stove from Kents set six Cherry trees amd about 40 current bushes on gurly place 
May 2d Mrs Dunphy moved her household goods back to Ohio ago Martin and Emma came out here 30th of April and until the 3d of May had cold rain
4th Martha went to see Dr McLaren
5th Sowed Peas and Onions 5th Martha and I went to Uncle Wm's got Strawberry plants 8th planted potatoes
8th the weather was so hot that we slept with nothing but sheet over us 12th planted corn, beans and beets 
12th turned old Brin out of the yard for the first time 
21st Corbett and Ada got back from Iowa 
23 planted white Meshanie potatoes from Iowa
17th May Martha real sick had Dr McLaren this morning

1874
May 26 Went to Chicago to attend Mrs Pelton's funeral clear beautiful day the flowers and shrubery lovely
27th Went to the new Methodist to see Mr Strobridge married Ada wore her new black silk dress for the first time delightful day - set out my box cucumbers
29 Ada and I went to Chicago she bought her bedstead and little bureau and I bought the pickets for the Lenox lot fence 
June 3d Mrs Hawley moved away from Martha's house and Martha commenced to move her things - had strawberries for the first time this year they were 18cts a box - 
June 4th Ada went to Chicago and got wall paper for dining room
" 6th Glorious good rain with lightning thunder and wind 
" 7th clear beautiful day 
"16 Have had cool and rather wet weather for the last week or two 
13th Corbett and Ada went to Leyden found Mr Willy very sick 
15 I went to Chicago and stayed two days to Alonzos 
18 Went to Strawberry festival at the new Congregational Church
22 got Strawberries to can and had stewed Cherries
24 Picked Cherries on Bassett trees - had first peas, have had awful hot weather for the past week
25 quite a hard wind with rain Martha and I at Mrs Brown's the Millleners  got a good soaking coming home
28 Corbett Ada and I went up to see Mr Willy called at Hemans, Wm's and Mrs Napier's 
July 3d Mrs Willey and Pulaski called here a short time 
July 4th Sam and Etta got home from England  weather very hot but it was a very happy day for us all 
6th they moved in their own house

1874
July 7-8-9-10 Picked Cherries to can and dry they are very ripe and nice at this time
July 11th Ada and I went to Chicago bought bedstead myself table spoon and knives and forks for Ada had dinner at Mrs Edwards, called at Mr Hickok
July 16 Picked currants for jelly Margaret came here 
" 20 Picked the last of our cherries
" 18 Martha and I went to Chicago, she bought a lounger and I bought extension table  - Susan Willey came 
July 19th Walter Kettlestrings baby died 
" 23 I went to Chicago awful hot day bought little bureau to put book case on
24th thought we were going to have a big rain and cleaned Martha's cistern but the showers all went around we had no rain here the hottest weather we every knew Thermometer 120 in Sun 105 in Shade 30 slight rain but not enough to do any good all went to St Georges Pic nic at Nelson Park
31 Cool pleasant weather
Aug 1st Sam and Corbett worked on Kenedys house
Aug 4 Martha Rena and I went to Leyden had dinner at Uncle Wms called a Mr Willey
8 Ada and Etta went to Chicago and Sister Dunphy and Philecta came out here and stayed over Sunday Mr Huett taken crazy so there was no services in Unity Church
11th Awful hot today Martha and Will stayed here all night wind blew very hard with fearful lightning and thunder
13th quite a cool comfortable day Will went to Niles to Calidonia Pic nic Sam and Etta went to ball to unclear
11 Tryster brought hay 15 Mrs Hickok Emma and Flora came out to make us a visit before going on their farm

1874 
Aug 18th Ada went to Chicago and paid one hundred and thirty dollars (134 00) on Pudgland lots
Aug 20th Went to Chicago with Mrs Hickok stayed (at Peltons all night)
" 21st The Hickok's left Chicago for their farm in Mc Henry 
" 22th A heavy thunder shower and most glorious good rain more than we have had in the last three months 
19th Went down in the woods to Mrs William's to get butter took Emma Flora Rena and two Paine children
25th Aunt Lucy and I went for a ride to Merrills grove 
27th Ada and Etta went up to Mr Willeys
29th Etta and I went to Town to attend auction bought nothing 
31th Martha's Pears ripe enough to pick though quite hard brought things we bought home from Mr Huett's 
Sept 4 Corbett and Ada went to Chicago were caught in an awful shower more rain fell than we have had at one time in two years it just poured down in torrents 
Sept 8th Martha Ada and I went to Leyden made Mrs Napier a visit and I stayed untill the next Sunday (13th)
10th Visited Sarah called at Mrs John Shaw and Mrs Gray 
11 Visited at Mr Willeys 13 bid Susan Willey good Bye and came home with our folks who had been visiting at Uncle Wm's
Sept 16 Ada and I went to Chicago in Buggy got vinegar Batting, Peaches, Pears, grapes  - and dry goods 
Sept 21th Ada and Etta went up to Hemans after cucumbers 
Sept 23d Corbett went to Chicago with Doll and old Bill brought a load of coal for Sam
24 Ada had a quilting the anniversary of her wedding day
26 Etta and I went to the Exposition - had rain

1874
Sept 27 Albert and wife came out here more rain
29th Paid Mr Kettlestring note of $100 00, dollars and $5 int
Oct 3d Corbett Ada Sam and Etta went to Exposition
5th Martha went to Exposition with Jenny Warswick had quite a heavy rain
8th Etta had quilting in commemoration of Ada s birthday had Uncle Oscar s folks and all our folks there to supper 
10th we had cucumbers to eat have not had frost enough to kill them
11th Corbett and Ada went down to Money s after pumkins
13th Julia Knott started for her home in Kansas had hard frost
16th had lettuce to eat grown in Uncle Oscar's garden - Martha Mrs Smart and I went to Chicago went half a day to Womans Congress
19 Etta and I went to Mc Gown s to get butter 21 Martha and I went to River Pass
22 Mrs Smart Ada Etta and I took a ride to Austin stoped at Ridgland called on Mrs Kenedy - at night it was so warm a katydid was singing - presume it was the last one of the season 
24th I went to Unity Church in forenoon and to Episcopal in the evening our folks all went to Leyden it was so warm - wore nothing around me but silk Lacyn
26 Ada and I went up to the old Wood place and got a load of pumpkins it was a warm pleasant day but rained awful hard in the night cleared off in the morning and was so warm we did not have a fire in the house, made our tea on Martha's stove 
29 our folks have gone to the ball at Austins hall it turned very cold in the night and the wind blew awful --
31 Ada and I went to Chicago bought two stoves -- 
Nov 3 I went to Chicago stayed all night at Dunphy s and traveled all day looking at stoves
7th Mrs Smart and I went to Leyden and Martha and Rena went to Chicago with Jenny Warswick

1874
Nov 8th Rena picked flowers in our garden and we had lettuce for supper from Mr Brewster s garden
Nov 10 Mrs Smart Martha and I went to old Mrs Warswick's visiting 
11th Martha and I went up to Mrs Sayres to meet Mrs Napier 
12 Ada and Corbett went to River Park brought home pumpkins for old Brin
13 carried Mrs Gerts down to Money's Mrs Napier came for us to witness her will 14th I carried her back to Sayres Corbett and Ada went to Town with waggon got bbl apples
18th Martha and Etta went to Chicago Ell got parlor stove paid 12 dollars
19 snow storm four inches deep 20 sleighs are out --
22 rain -- snow all gone 24th Old Brin was killed --
26 another snow storm 30th snow enough for sleiging --
Dec 5 Martha and I went to Chicago bought each of us a bbl of Apples the weather has been mild --snow all gone -- muddy --
6th Corbett and Ada went to Chicago in waggen stayed all night (to Alberts)
8th Corbett s flour come from Iowa --
11th Mrs Baldwin Mrs Morey and myself took dinner with Mrs Harkness
14th Mrs Smart had her comforter made -- nice warm day 
16 Etta - Arthur-Ada- and I eat dinner with Martha (Will gone to Wis hunting)
18th Martha s birth day she washed and I went to Chicago Laura came here from Chicago 24th we went to see Christmas tree at Congregational Church and then went to Austin s hall to see them dance a while Laura went to the dance Christmas we all had supper at Aunt Lucy's the next day at Martha's the next day Sunday 
27th Laura went home -- Will Martha and Rena went down to Warswick's to eat turkey dinner -- misty damp day none of us went to Church

1874 
Dec 28-29 Mrs Horton had her flower queen exibition at Unity Church 31 George Rowley came down here and stayed all night
1875
Jan 1st Well we have all lived to see another New Years day and are all well and comfortable for which we, I hope, are truly thankful, we know not what another year may bring forth, our family circle may be broken and some one of us be missing sooner or later that time will surely come, and how little we realize it, yet it is best I suppose that we do not, as it would embitter all our lives, so we must try to enjoy ourselves as well as we can while we are permited to be together -- we all stayed at home but in the evening Corbett , Ada, Sam and Etta, Mrs Edgby and Mrs M Kettlestring spent the evening at Martha's -- Will and Martha went down to unclear and stayed all night very comfortable weather, no snow 
Sat 2d turned cold, 3d colder 4th coldest night of the season, Thermometer 10 degrees below zero 
5th Not quite so cold snowed a little - 6th Corbett and Ada went to Chicago in Buggy and went to Hooly's theater
Friday 8th Comfortable day but at night it turned fearfully cold and on the morning of the 9th thermometer 24 degrees below zero coldest weather since 1864 - 12th quite a comfortable day took a walk up Town called at Mrs Turners, and Mr Dunlaps -- Arthur took stray horse to Pound
13th colder with some snow -- 14th very cold again fell down on ice and hurting back 
19th Uncle George and Libbie came out here 
21st quite warm thawed very fast snow most all gone
22d cold again Dunphy went home - 23d warm day
24th cold again Corbett and Sam went to Mr John's to see hay 
25th Johns brought the hay for Sam 29th Ada and Ett bought hay in Town

1875
Feb 1st We both commenced feeding on our new hay
2d Arthur to River Park to see about getting wood - it rained and snowed alternately all day our folks went to Maywood ball
3d turned awful cold, wind blew a perfect hurricane all day all night and all the next day when it began to lull --
4th weather more comfortable Corbett and Ada went to Unity Church Oyster supper 8th have had very cold weather for three days
10th Snowed all day Corbett, Sam Adda and Ett went up to Willeys in sleigh got 7lbs butter and qt of milk
13th Willey's folks came down here brought Gowell with them had a dance
15th Heard of the death of M.L. Dunlap which occured 14th very cold 
19th Sam Etta and I went up to Winston's in sleigh --George Dunphy came out and stayed untill the 23d 22d Charley Rowley came down here and stayed two days went to Unity Church entertainment have been having a thaw with rain but it turned cold and froze it all up it is icy all over, and fine sleighing 26-27 pretty cold weather  Sam and Corbett went to Winstons sale -- 28 big snow storm
March 1st very blustering day, snowed and blowed furiously Mr Morey buried but the storm prevented us going to funeral 
2d very pleasant day 3d worst snow storm of the season
4th mild day I went to Chicago Sam and Etta went in sleigh I stayed untill the 8th visited Alberts folks, Clarenda, and Dunphys went to hear Mrs Van Cott preach -- good sleighing all around Town sleigh bells gingling every where was cold all the time I was in the city 10th still continues cold sleiging good 
11th More mild Martha and I went to Temperance hall to entertainment 
12 and 13 quite warm thawing very fast all slop and slush
14 Sam Ett and Martha went to Chicago to hear Susan Anthony lecture

1875
Stayed in the evening and went to hear Mrs Van Cott preach 
March 15 turned awful cold wind blew a perfect gale for 24 hours water all froze up and it is cold as Greenland so the boys could not work I fixed carpet bottoms in our old chairs
March 20 cold north wind has been very cold all the past week 
22d more mild 23d very slopy -- Josie and I went to Spelling School
26-27 first real spring like days we have had - heard robin for first time
28th Went to hear Mr Huett preach his last sermon in Oak Park
30 warm fine day -- went to Chicago exchanged s --k --
April 1st cold with very high wind Sam and Ell moved to Ridgland
2d Ada and I went to School exibition and to Ridgland
4th Mr De Wolf came here 5th I went to Chicago to be witness for Mrs Napier stayed all night at Dunphy's 
8th Martha and I went to hear the Jubilee singers 
7th sowed lettuce radishes and onions 11 rained all day 
9th Corbett got hens from Langs
Apr12th snow fell two inches deep 13 Rena went home with Etta to Ridgland stayed all night came home next day and went back with her 10th Josiphine started for New York 
13th great snow storm down East snow a foot deep in Boston 
15 turned very cold frost on windows ground froze hard water froze in Martha's kitchen
21 weather continues cold Martha and I went to Chicago we suffered all day with cold froze hard last night and in fact every night the past week sleep under as many bed clothes as we did in mid winter -- 21 Martha bought her carpet 
23 Mr Paine's folks moved to Galewood
28 Etta moved back from Ridgland -- weather comfortably warm whitewashed kitchen in the Lenox house--

1875
April 27 Ada and I went to Mr Mores to get potatos to plant
May 1st cold rainy day with a sprinkling of snow Sam Calsomined the Lenox house and painted the kitchen and pantry floor 
3d rain again 5th Sam's folks moved in my house
7th Mr Straight moved in Sam's house froze quite hard at night Josie got home from Orange County -- 8th quite a warm day sowed Peas
9th rainy sunday and quite cool and chilly slept in woolen blankets untill the 8 of May -- 10th planted corn and potatos --
12th rainy and cool -- went to Mrs Mark's got eggs
13th had the first lettuce -- Lizie Patterson went to Rochelle yesterday 
14th cold and uncomfortable -- 15 very cold wind all day Ell Rena and I went to Chicago bought Martha's bedstead and 3 chairs 
16th clear beautiful day -- went to hear Mr Mabie preach --Mr FitzPatrick and his little girls came out here and stayed all night -- Arthur went to Chicago to carry a grass widow weather cold it froze ice in a tub as thick as window glass have had frost for the past three or four nights 
17th warm pleasant day 18th Mr Paine worked on Piazza 
20 Sister Dunphy came out here -- 21th fine shower of rain got the Lenox house insured -- 23d heavy rain cherries and currants in blossom -- 28th attended Mrs McNeal's funeral  showery in the forenoon rained hard afternoon -- 31 went to Mr Edgly funeral -- June 1st thunder shower and heavy rain
June 5th went to Chicago got wash stand and looking glass and Martha's bracket called at Dunphy's on Park Ave 
June 6th painted our kitchen floor 7th had first gooseberries 
"June 5 had first strawberries they were 18cts a box --
11th very hot day went without stockings, drawers, and most

1875
every thing else slept with no cover but sheets
12th turned so cold had to bring out bed clothes almost enough for winter had slight frost at night
13th Still cold and uncomfortable went to hear Herford Brook preach in Unity Church
14 Etta and Mrs Smart went to Chicago with Doll in Buggy 
15 Quite a heavy rain -- 18 Margaret and Laura came down here Laura stayed all night and went to Chicago--
20th Corbett Ada Josie and I went to River Park dedication heard Professor Swing for the first time very hot day 
21 Etta quite sick with sore throat -- rain again 
June 22d Went to Methodist Strawberry festival in the the wind blew a perfect gale accompanied by heavy rain thunder & lightning
26 Ada and I went to Chicago in Buggy took dinner at George Willeys restaurant got butter of Pulaski got case of Strawberries (16qts) for one dollar 
30 Canned pie plant went to Ridgland with Mrs Smart
July 1st Ada and I went to School Exibition -- had rain
2d more rain 3d very hot day 
4th Another fourth has come around and we have all been permitted to live and get together and enjoy ourselves as well as circumstances would admit we all took dinner at Sam's had roast lamb, green peas, new potatoes, cherry pie
5th Sam and Ett took a ride up to Turner Park in the night had awful heavy rain and turned quite cool 
6th more rain -- 7th rain had last strawberries -
8th Had first blackcapberries Ada, Rena, and I went up to Wm's had dinner then went down to Mr Willeys to get butter and eggs
9th Went to Chicago Rena went with me and stayed at Mr Lenox while I went down Town

1875
July 13th Sam Ett Corbett Ada and Mrs Smart all went to Chicago Sam and Ett went to Barnum's show Corbett and Ada had their Photographs taken 
14th Pretty hot day Rena and I went up to Galewood to Mr Paines folks
15th Had a hard shower in the night wind blew almost a hurricane we were considerably frightened -- canned currants had first cucumber 
16th -- 17th More rain -- Sam and Corbett went in Town Saturday night in the rain
18th Clear and pleasant but very cool at night 
22d I went to Chicago to get lumber for barn -- had heavy shower 
23 Josie, Rena and I went down to Jennie Warswick's to take currants 
24 Rena and I went to Austin for ride -- 25 more rain 
26 Sam went to Rockfard -- 28 rained all day 
30 Martha's baby born 31 awful heaving rain
Aug 1st so cold we needed fire to keep comfortable had to sleep with two quilts over us -- 3d heavy rain with wind and hail in some places -- and hurricane in Fountain county, Ind
5th Etta and I went to Chicago after vinegar but did not get it -- had a great storm at night awful lightning and tornado in the vicinity of Galesburg 
7th Rena and I went to Chicago to get the vinegar Sister Dunphy came home with us -- 8 had first green corn 
10th Rain again Rena went up to Mr Paines he finished the barn -- 
11 went after Rena 12 Sister D went home -- Lucy Versimers Dede Eva and Nellie all came down here Sam and Ett went up to Willeys 
13 fine pleasant day Aunt Lucy and Josie here all day ironing and sewing carpet rags 
15 Another awful rain storm 19 Etta and I went to Leyden to get a girl but did not get one 22 Rena and I went to Leydon got Lizie Jacques 23 Etta and I went to Town carried carpet rags Mrs Napier came with us

1875
25th carried Mrs Napier up as far as Mrs Sayres--
27 Rena Lizie and I went to the woods to get elm bark
28 Sam and Ett went to Chicago got her rag carpet got peaches ang grapes
30 Lizie Rena and I went to Leyden very hot day has been so far the past week most of the time sleep without anything over us 
Sept 2d Another heavy rain lightning and thunder
" 4th Mira and Laura came down here only stayed about an hour 
" 5th Fred Margaret and Mira came and stayed about as long went to Unity Church to hear the new Minister Mr Hines -- 
8th went to Chicago with Jennie Warswick
9th went to Unity Church reception had an awful big rain turned real cold -- 12th warm pleasant day
16 Mrs Willley and Margaret came down here and stayed to tea
18 Ada's baby came to unclear 19 I was a little sick took a dose of pills not able to work for a couple of days 
21st On the trot again all right 22 Sam and Ell went up to Willey's
25 Sam, Etta, Lauren Mr and Mrs Smart all went to the Exposition
Oct 2d Lizie Rena and I went to Exposition saw blackberries and plums on water street
3d Went to Leyden took Lizie home warm comfortable day
4th Sam and Ella went to dramatic entertainment at Unity Church 
7th Martha and I went to Chicago to look for stoves she bought one for seven dollars -- 8th Sister D came out here stayed all night -- cold rain 
13th Went to Chicago to look for stoves run all day and die one to suit me and last spectacular silver 
Oct 11 Mrs West came here and next day I took her up as far as Shaw 
18th had a flurry of snow 19th Arthur commenced the milk business Emma Hickok came out here and stayed two nights
21 Fred, Mrs Willey, Mira, and Laura called here, real warm day 
22 very warm fine day Martha and I went to Uncle Williams to spend the day called at Mrs Napiers -- 23 Another warm day 
24th Quite cool Ada rode out for the first time since her baby was born came home sick with chills --
26 turned very cold with high wind and a little sprink-ling of snow 27th more mild I went to Chicago bought me some woolen blankets

1875
Nov 3 went to Chicago with Corbett to buy stoves got new range and parlor stove -- Mr Merrill paid me $12.50 
4th went to old folks concert at Temperance Hall Baptist 
7th Richard, Lucy, Eva, Nellie, and baby Maud all came down here to see Ada's baby fine warm day -- 8th warm day
11th Martha and Etta went to Chicago Ett bought tub butter (23 lbs) for 25 cts lb
16th Corbett got 1/2 ton of range coal and 1/2 a ton nut coal
15th Little snow storm and quite cold
17 -- 18 More mild snow gone  -- 20 warm still sunny day almost like spring
21 Fred Margaret and Mira came down her brought jar of butter stayed in evening -- real cold day 
24 I went to Town to get Abstract stayed all night at Alberts and went to Dunphy's Thanksgiving day Morris Chittenden came brought news of the death of his father 
26 When I got home from Chicago found Rena had whooping cough Sam and Etta went up to Mr Willey's to spend Thanksgiving I stayed all night, Etta had awful sick head ache -- Will, Martha, and Rena, had dinner with Corbett & Ada 
29th coldest weather we have had so far this season -- below zero 
30th more mild 31 very comfortable day 
Dec 1st clear beautiful day not cold at all --
3d 4th 5th warm foggy , misty, nasty, weather
11th Mrs Fitzpatrick came here from Iowa -- slight flurry of snow 
12 colder -- 15th we attended May Foster's wedding fine day 
16th cold windy day 4 degrees below zero 
17th cold Sam and Corbett got hog 19 more mild they up to Uncle Williams got onions and 3 bush potatos of Mare

1875
Dec 20th Sam and Corbett went up to Galewood to finish a job very fine warm day 22d I went to Chicago with Josephine got Rena and Accordion -- warm day -- 23d Mira to stay with Etta
