24th heavy rain -- cleared off in afternoon Martha Josie & Mira went to the Episcopal Church and to the Methodists Church to see their Christmas trees Corbett and Ada went to Episcopal Church 
25th Christmas very mild and pleasant all our folks put their dinners together and eat with Corbetts had baked ducks and Chicken pie with the usual accompaniments -- Mira Willey and all Fitzpatrick's folks our only guests
26 rain and snow -- Sam Ett and Mira went to Unity Church 
27 Mira went home pleasant day 29 continues warm 
30 I went to Chicago so warm that I was uncomfortable walking about the streets called to see Mr Roberts about Abstract 
31 warm rainy day had doors open could sit comfortably without fire good part of the day Arthur had his lawsuit with John Hagen 
1876
Jan 1st Another year has rolled around and we are all yet in the land of the living our family circle is yet unbroken and two more have been added to our number and yet we are not happy day after day and week after week we plod on fretted by petty cares and perplexities when we should be enjoying ourselves for we have great reason to be thankful that our lives have all been spared -- for health and comfortable homes while thousands of poor miserable creatures know not what it is to have a home and friends -- God help them, for this is a selfish unfeeling world -- It has been dark and gloomy most of the day

1876
sun shone out about noon was so warm we had outside door open -- our folks thought they must have some pleasure New Years day so Sam Corbett Ada and Etta went to Chicago to Matinee toward night it began to rain and poured down furiously but after dark it cleared off and the wind blew a perfect gale all night -- I eat my New Years dinner with Martha Sam Etta and Mr Smart took theirs alone (Mrs Smart at the River house) Corbett Ada Mrs Fitz Patrick and her three children made their family dinner party -- Theo Williams came home with our folks from Chicago and stayed over Sunday -- 
Jan 3d - 4th very pleasant comfortable days went around with Subscription for Humane Society Arthur camed selling milk again 
5th Arthur and Mrs Fitz went to Chicago in waggon -- Arthur fell out the waggon and sprained his ankle
6th weather continues fine went around with my paper again 
7th Ada went to Chicago bought her a new shawl and calico dress 
8 - 9 rained hard and at night turned cold and remained so until the 14th it begun to get warm again 
13 Corbett Ada and myself went to pound party to Mr Hines 
14 Sam and Etta went to Thatcher to Centenial Sociable 
Jan 15 Went to Chicago to give Deed to Mr Merrill bought me a new pair of silver bowed spectacles -- stoped awhile at Dunphys 16th had rain 
17th Cleared off very warm and pleasant it was so warm that I slept a great part of the night with only one quilt and cotton sheet
18th So warm that I am sitting in Marthas east chamber writing with the window open has been raining part of the day last Thursday (13th) Martha had a quilting

1876
Mrs Fitz and Josie and Mrs Walter Kettlestring were all she had besides our own folks 
19 - 20 - cold 21 warm with rain 20th Mrs Fitz had quilting 
25 Martha and I went to Chicago to Poultry show - Arthur got hurt by jumping from the cars -- 
26 Mrs FitzPatrick moved to Chicago warm day 
28 turned cold froze the mud up in a hurry and blew a terrible gale all night -- 29 - 30 pretty cold 
Jan 31 very fine pleasant day we washed and was not cold at all putting out clothes uncle Leonard Perry came to see us --
Feb 1st snow storm but not enough to make sleighing -- high wind pretty cold but Uncle L went off to Chicago in the storm 
2d went in Town expecting to see uncle but he had gone out to Hiram Perrys I stayed all night at Dunphy on Park Avenue 
3d It snowed moderately all the forenoon - I went down street bought my Empress dress called on Mrs Edwards then came home - uncle L came out on the 6 o clock train stayed all night left on seven A.M for Milwaukie 
5th Mr Reynolds son was buried (killed on Railroad) Josephine and Etta attended the funeral and went to Rose Hill 
Feb 8th Warm hazy day went to Oyster supper to unity Church it rained furiously all night with lightning and heavy thunder 
9th it rained nearly all day more water on the ground than we have had in a long time 
10th so warm we had doors open and at night slept with only quilt over us 
11th cooler froze a little at night 12 - 13 warm and pleasant --
14 - 15 quite cold with a little snow Corbet and Ada went to Chicago got baby high chair and crib 
16 I went to Chicago to Mr Huetts Surprise party 
17 Mrs Smart had quilting - 22 I went to Chicago to get things for Masqurad  Corbett Ada Sam and Etta went to the ball -- 
29 very pleasant day has bee uncommonly mild all winter no snow of any account - boys have not had a chance to use their fine cutter at all

1876
March 1st
Heaviest snow storm of the season but not very cold
3 - 4 - 5 weather mild - snow all gone - roads very mudy
6th rainy and windy - Will moved his work bench in his new shop 
7th sent Mrs Mc Combers Bible --
8th Marthas baby very bad with Chicken pox --
10th Mrs Willey died -- thunder and rain at night 
13th Attended Mrs Willeys funeral  - Mr Hines preached (or talked) roads awful bad 
14 Mr Willey died - 15th quite a heavy snow storm going so bad we could not go 
17th cold stormy day Mr Willey buried
20 snowed most all day wind north seems like midwinter, a week ago it was so warm the robins and larks were singing and slept with only one quilt over us took off flannels and almost every thing else 
25th very pleasant overhead but slop and slush underfoot have had more snow the last week than we have had before this winter but it is going fast now 
27th Martha went to Chicago and paid the Willey note 
28th Worst snow storm we have had and drifted worse than at any time in all winter 
31 Warm bright comfortable day -- visited Oak Park School 
April 1st fine warm day -- 22d stormy sleet and rain 
8 - 9 very pleasant Clarenda and Flora came out here 
11th Ella went to Chicago had an awful storm rain hail thunder and much lighning roads awful muddy -- 
12th Another awful rain the whole county flooded 
16th I went to Chicago to hear Mrs Livermore lecture but failed to hear her, went in the evening to hear the Hutchinsons sing stayed all night at Dunphys called to see Malvina Deo and Cornelia Wheaten  (that was)
24th Went down to Shauble's got lettuce seeds sowed it quite cold have not taken off our wolen blanket yet 
29th very little rain Ada sowed peas and radishes 
30 very cold uncomfortable day

1876
May 4th Martha and I went up to Mr Willeys found Henrys wife and her sister there -- rained before we got home --
" 6th Had an awful heavy rain storm and hard blow regular hurricane in Chicago 
" 9th I went to Congregational Church entertainment 
May 17th Ada and I went to Chicago had Fanny's first picture taken
18 - 19 20 very warm with frequent showers
May 22d had a call to go to Mrs Kenedy's wind blew a perfect gale and it was so cold that I suffered very much, at night had slight frost, Mrs Gurly died, was buried the 24th it was a clear beautiful day Sister Dunphy came same day and attended her funeral -- 25 she and I went up to uncle Wms and stayed all night -- called awhile at Willeys next day 
May 28th The weather the past five days has been perfect, just warm enough to b comfortable and so calm and still -- 
30 Sister D and all the rest of us took Tea at Mrs Brewsters
31 Went riding to Haas Park - called at Warswicks had a glorious good rain in the afternoon -- 
June 1st Etta and I went home with Aunt Libbie - got hats and bonnets - had strawberries the 30th of May -- 
" 4th Sam Etta Corbett and Ada all went up tot Mr Willeys 
" 6th Rena and I went out to Mc Henry county to visit Mr Hickok's folks had a real nice time the country looked beautiful and the weather was very fine -- stayed until the 10th 
11th Albert and wife came out there -- had first gooseberries --
12 - 13 - 14 had a very heavy rain - 3d June bought strawberries for 12 cts box
17th It has rained everyday the past week
20th commenced to use cherries - 21 Martha went to Chicago 
22 I went to Chicago, got 15 lbs feathers to fill up our old bed had seven old broken teeth taken out stayed all night at Dunphys

1876
June 24th Unity Church had Pic-nic excusion -- 
25 - 26th Pretty hot weather with much rain - raspberries beginning to ripen
25 Mira and Laura came down to Church -- went down to Warswicks 
27 Martha went to Chicago on business
30th Lucy Eva and Nellie came down here and brought cherries 
July 1st Corbett got Adas brown dress and Cashmere sague
" 2d Sam Etta and Rena went to Riverside in their new Buggy
" 4th All our folks (but myself) and Walter Kettlestring and wife went down to Warswick's to have Pic nic Charley Rowley also  it was a very pleasant day but had an awful storm at night with floods and hurricanes in some parts of the country and many lives were lost --
6th Alice Peirce arrived here - 8th - 9th extremely hot weather 
July 9th Alice feeling quite unwell 10th was worse called in Dr Tope very hot day - 12th Mrs Smart went to nurse Mrs York we are all very busy picking berries, and doing most every thing else
17th Etta went to Chicago to get money out of the Bank, it was the hottest day of the season had and awful thunder shower 
18 - 19 awful hot days - 20th I went with Mrs Warswick to Maywood to see Dr Lackey quite cool and comfortable 
21st Alice and Etta went to Chicago to stay a few days 
22d It was so cold that we slept under two quilts -- the fore part of the week it was so hot that we could not stay in the chamber untill the latter part of the night -- and slept without anything over us 
25th I went to Chicago got part of a set of teeth had my own cleaned Uncle Oscar very sick -- Alice and Ett got home from Chicago 
July 30 Corbett, Ada, Sam, Etta, and Alice went to Lincoln Park 
Aug 1st Sam commenced the milk business 
5th Alice went to Peltons to stay awhile Ada and I went

1876
in Town with her when we got to the Depot it rained and Pelton took us in his carriage down to Wabash Avenue with sewing Machine 
8th Mrs Kenedy Rena and I went up to Mrs Paines visiting -- 
10th Sam and Etta went to Leyden got caught in an awful thunder shower when they were coming home --
11th The Dr's have given uncle Oscar up to die we expect every day to be his last on Earth -- weather very hot and sultry -- 
12th The poor man is gone the way of all the world he breathed his last at ten O clock to night -- O how desolate and lonely their home must be without him and how sad to see the strong man brought down to the weakness and helplessness of a child a perfect wreck of humanitys he was buried the 15th Etta and Alice went to Leyden the 13the brought Laura home with them 
17th I went to Chicago rode in and out with Corbett in Buggy -- 
18th Alice started for Minesota -- Martha has been sick two weeks 
Aug 27 Corbett Ada Rena and I went to Desplaines Camp Meeting 
Sept 18 Fannie picture taken Jane Judson Allen's son called to see us 
Sept 22 Josipine went to Wheaton to take care of her Aunt Joanna who had fallen down stairs and broke her arm Aunt Lucy stays alone 
23d Will and Martha went to Chicago had Allic's picture taken 
24th Etta and I went up to Leyden to visit our friends for a few days 
26th Margaret and I went to Chicago on the old plank road had not been on that road for over ten years -- 29th Margaret brought us home --
Sept 30th Corbet Ada Sam and Etta went to Exposition -- first frost 
Oct 1st Clear cool day -- Richard, Lucy and Nellie came down here 
" 3d Martha Ada and Josie went up to Wms and Hemans found Aunt Lura sick with something resembling Typhoid fever 
4th real cold for this time of year -- 5th Mrs Smart went to Jenny unclear
8th Margaret and Laura came down here to Church 
9th Martha and I went to the Exposition

1876
Oct
10th - 11th Cold uncomfortable weather 12th Ada and I went to Maywood to buy shoes
15th Margaret and Mira came down to hear Mr Bolch preach
17th Etta and I went down to Neffs to see about cherry trees - our kindling choped & put in shed
18th very warm pleasant day Sam and Etta went to Lombard
20th rained hard but was quite warm -- The 31 of Aug I left home with the intention of going to Vt but went to Michigan instead was gone about two weeks, very sorry I did not go to VT 
21st I went to Chicago bought Rena's Waterproof under wear for myself
24th Etta and I went to Chicago to get our teeth filled she had one drawn -- Rena went with us and had a little tooth taken out 
25th cold and chilly slept in woolen blankets -- 28 quite warm and pleasant 
29th Another very warm day more like summer than otherwise - crickets singing Corbett and Ada gone to Chicago they went to Leyden the 25th 
Oct 30 Martha and I went up to Uncle Wm's it was like a summer day only wore a thin shawl and no gloves to drive -- roads fine 
31 Another warm day have been triming briars all day --- 
Nov 1st Warm rain Sam's horse ran away and most killed herself 
3d Arthur went up after Uncle Wm he came down and stayed a week
6 Stormy, cold rain and a little snow 
7th more mild quite a decent for Election -- Mrs Warswick died --and was buried the 8th - 9th went to Chicago with Wm and he had his Photograph taken -- called at Peltons left him there went to Moody noon meeting 
12th Martha and I went up to Mr Moore's got potatoes went to Moneys got husks and corn - warm pleasant day -- 
12th Sam and Etta Walter and wife went up to see Maggie with her broken leg 
13 Wm came from Chicago and Sam carried him home in the rain 
14th first snow storm but is not cold -- Corbett had two tons of hard coal ($15.00) brought to day

1876
Nov 18 It has been cloudy all the past week think the sun has not shone once I went to Chicago and it rained most all day 
17th Went to Hoards new Hall to see Uncle Tom's cabin played 
22 Sent a letter to Aunt M with my Photo in it 
23 got our parlor stove put up, also drum and unclear on the two tons coal
24 Attended Mr Curriers funeral -- 28 - 29 pretty cold with some snow, but not enough to make sleiging the roads too rough
30th Thanksgiving Aunt Lucys Josie and I eat turkey at Sam's Corbett and Ada thought they would have a sleigh ride but did not go as far as Ridgland the road was so rough sleighing too poor 
Dec 4th Sam had poor Flora shot - 5 killed on of their pigs 
" 6 I went to Chicago got Martha Tea knives --
" 8th - 9th Extremely cold weather Thermometer on the morning of the 9th - 15 degrees below zero, colder than any time last winter 
" 12 Sam took Versimers old gray home and I went up with him and Eva came back with him I stayed one night at Wm's one night with Mrs Napier and to Willeys the rest of the time untill Sunday (the 17) came home with Corbett and Ada snowed very fast all day 
18th Martha's birthday - Richard and Lucy came down after Eva (very cold day)
25 Had Christmas supper at our house Aunt Lucy and Josie took supper with us Oysters was the principle dish Martha, Rena, Allie and I took a short sleigh ride but long enough to decide that it was more pain than pleasure 
26 Sam went to Town in sleigh Ett went with and stoped to Dunphy's untill he got back from down Town -- Corbett got frig from Walter -- 29 getting much colder --terible Railroad disaster at Ashtabula O-o over a hundred lost most of them being burned to death

1877
Jan 1st We all went up to Uncle Wm's to spend New Years day it was very cold sleighing good most of the way -- had a good time while we were there and a good dinner but had a break down coming home, and got pretty cold and was rather late home
5th it has been very cold the past week -- Sam and Ellen went up to Wiiley
6 Sam and Etta went to Chicago in sleigh 
8-9 A little more snow pretty cold 1 degrees below zero
10th More mild Etta and I went up to Mrs Gillingham's 
11th More snow 12 - 13 Colder with more snow 
15th snowed and blowed all day - Corbett and Ada went to Chicago in Bob sleigh Sam started to go with Cutter got as far as Austin and the snow was drifted so bad he came back - 18 - 19th thawed some 
20th very cold Josie went to Chicago in sleigh with Sam -- 
21 One of Mr Millars children died to day while they were having the funeral services for the other one that died three days before of Scarlet fever 
24 I went to Chicago got Martha center table --
25 Paid taxes on Oak Park property  - in the we went to entertainment at Hoards Hall - Mrs Harkness taken very sick same night 
26 - 27 very fine days sleighing good but Marthas baby sick so we could not go out riding 
28th Mrs Harkness died to day -- Fred Margaret and Mira came down for the first time since Maggie's leg was broken
Feb 1st took my knitting and went over to Mrs Hastings stayed all the afternoon 
" 2d Ada went up to Mrs Gillingham's - warm for a few days frost snow all gone only the remains of a few banks in corners of fences 
5th Went to entertainment for benefit of poor at Hoards Hall 
Feb 13 clear beautiful day have not had a drop of rain or snow this month so far nor any high winds -- last night Rena and I went to see the masquerade (at Hoards Hall) ball 
15 I went to Chicago and stayed two nights at Dunphys made Clarenda a short visit -- spent the evening at Alberts --

1877
Feb 19th Etta went to Dentist Ritter and had one of her front teeth taken out 
22d rained just a very little think it is the first we have had since the 18th of Nov have had no snow fall since the 15th of Jan 28 Etta had the rest of her front teeth out and it most killed her poor child it is too bad that she must suffer so much and lose her teeth when they might just as well have been saved if they had not been neglected so long and I am the most to blame for being so stupid 
" 2d snow but it melted as fast as it fell
" 3d It snowed steady all day untill it was about 9 inches deep 
5th Mr Sherman died on Haye's inaugeration day 
6th I was taken sick, before I knew it the girls had sent for Dr Cash he called to see me three times had not had a Dr for more than 20 years before  and if I had only taken a dose of Jayner pill presume I should not have required one at all - Ad has not been well for two weeks past 
7th - 8th - 9th very cold days plenty of snow but drifted so is not good sleighing 
11th Corbett and Ada went to Fitz Patrick 
12th It has snowed all day I have just got able to be up around but not to work much 14 Sam Etta and Josie went up to Willys in sleigh found Mira alone Maggie in Town taking care of George Laura staying in Town to be treated by Dr
18th Pickard Lucy Nellie and and Maud came down her sleighing first rate --Patterson came here to board with Corbett
March 20 snow storm right from NE dark and dismal with some thunder 
23 - 24 more snow - good sleighing 26

1877
April 1 very high wind, turned cold at night froze quite hard at night 
3d I went to see old Mrs Kettlestring, and called at Mrs Eckharts 
5th Went to Chicago bought Etta and myself cashmere dress 
6th went down to see Mrs. Welch
12th Lizie Patterson came here to attend the Mason's Ball 
13 Ada Colsomined kitchen 16th showery with some thunder 
16-17 Corbet Colsomined and grained the Gurly house 19 - rain 
21 Ada and Etta went up to Mr Mores to get potatoes
22 Corbett, Ada, Rena and Fannie went for ride to Central Park warm day
27 Cold with a little rain Allie has been sick the past week had Dr Tope three or four times - Lindon moved out of Sam's house yesterday 
29th Cold and cloudy -- Mr Fitzpartick and two other gentlemen his friends walked out here 
30 cold miserable day with slight flurries of snow and hard frost at night Ada moved over to Lake Street to make herself very uncomfortable and left me alone to get along as best I may -- I never would have believed that either one of my girls would have done such a thing 
May 1st Clear pleasant day but very cold have slept in woolen blankets the last three or four nights, and had as many quilts over us as we did in winter 
3d Ada and I went to Chicago she got her a new bedstead --
2d Ada and I went to John Steele's got Cherry trees and grape (Martha) vines 
4th Mrs Smart had her quilting -- to send to England 
9th Ada and I worked all day in garden planted potatoes - corn beans - Peas - onions - lettuce and cucumbers -- Sister D came out here the 15 she and I went up to Mr Willeys stayed all night and the next day made a visit to Uncl Williams 
16th heavy rain -- 17th 18th very hot for this time of year 
22d real cold -- 23d 24th 25th, very cold - hard frost in some places but the East wind prevented it doing injury here but it has been uncomfortably cold so we had to keep fires all day and sleet with winter coverings nights

1877
May 26th A little warmer to day Arthur painted the inside of my kitchen 
30th Martha and I went to Norwood Cemetery -- Decoration day --
31st Mrs Rose Kettlestring and Etta went up to Mr Willeys
June 6th Wm and Lura came down here got Lucy s big rocking chair
8th Had an awful heavy rain pretty cold 9th Etta went to Chicago in the rain to pay taxes -- 11th more rain weather cool 
12th I went to Town stayed all night at Dunphy s 
15th Another awful shower it has rained almost every night the past week 
18th Heavy rain storm 19 Sam and Etta went to Michigan the Lake was very rough and they were both sea sick - they got home the 19th Aaron came home with them there was more rain with much lightning thunder and wind a most fearful night to cross the Lake -- 
25th Had an awful storm of rain, wind, and thunder great damage done in many places, Aaron left here was going to Chicago to stay all night and go home next day 
28th Allie sick -- 30 Fannie sick 
July 1st Oscar Pelton and family came out here had first ripe currants 
2d Had another great storm of wind, rain, and hail 
5th I went to Chicago to attend the Humane Society meeting had a terrible storm -- much lightning thunder, rain & wind it was so dark they had to light the gas -- was much frightened took Rena with me left her at Fitz Patrick s had supper with them stayed all night at Dunphy's sister D gone out to Em's, went down to Clarenda s found M Hickok and Flora there in the afternoon we all went to Barnum s show Rena and I went to Peltons and stayed all night -- then went to Alberts to dinner -- came home at six - very hot weather 
14th Martha Rena Allie and myself all went up to Mrs Napier's to make her a visit very hot day

1877
July 15th Lucia Allen came here from Iowa
18th I went to central Park to meet Mrs Hickok Flora and Mrs Dunphy 21 Corbett and Ada went to Chicago in wagon to concert took Mrs Hickok and Dunphy back to Town
25th we all went to Central Park to family Pic-nic -- rained a little
26th - 27th Rena sick with Cholera morbus so she could not go to Sunday Scool Pic-nic 
28 Corbitt, Sam, Ada, Etta went to Lake Zurich they came back the 30th -- 31th I went to Chicago very hot day 
Aug 3d Mrs Smart Martha and I went to Baptist Pic-nic to Maywood -- Corbett and Ada went to Chicago got Parlor table 
Aug 6th Aunt Lucy Josie and all the rest of our folks were all at Sam's to eat ice cream -- it may be the last night we shall all be together as I expect to leave home tomorrow for the East 
Aug 7th Left Chicago at nine O clock eve bound to VT arrived at Sarnia half past 12 next day ought to have been there four hours sooner but were delayed by a broken down train -- got to Toronto about dark to Montreal at nine next morning to Burlington at half past one to Shelburn about two got a ride over to Homers with a young lady (a Miss Green) 
10th was intending to go to Aunt Me s but just before we got ready to start Aunt Lucia and Mr Sawyer came and spent the day -- 11th Homer and Lucy went with me to Aunt's to the old home of my childhood -- but O how changed the old familiar faces all gone the house and and out buildings remodeled untill they are not the same -- nothing but the everlasting hills and grand old mountains remain unchanged

1877
Aug
14th It has rained nearly every day for a week -- very warm 
15th Aunt and I went to Hinesburgh village stayed all night at Mr Colemans -- took dinner at Mrs Allen s called on Andrew Curry -- visited Lucy Powell (that was) came home the 16-18 visited Mrs Hannah Russell and took a ramble over the rocks and hills and through woods where I was wont to stroll with my school mates in the happy days of childhood 
19th Had a thunder shower, stayed at home all day 
21st Went to Hinesburgh pond after blackberries but did not get any 
22 visited at Mr Sawyers he went and brought Romilla over there and we all had a good visit together -- I went home with her and stayed all night Aunt came next morning to spend the day -- had two very hot days Thermometer 90 in shade 
25 Davis and Abba and I went to the pond found uncle Ralphs girls and a number of others there fishing but it was no pleasure to me to see them and the romance of the pond, the ricks, and the woods were gone -- gone with the departed friends of my youth -- never more to return 
27 Romilla came to spend the day with us -- 29 Harrison came home 
31 Harrison and I went to School Pic nic in Homers sugar woods 
Sept 1st Heavy rain -- 3d Harrison went to Uncle Ralphs  they were all in the woods taking up a bee tree we followed on and had our fill of honey 
4th We went out to Homers and the next day went to Essex junction to a fair 
6th Went out to Irwin Rowley s they were not at home so came back to George Curry s and stayed all night and untill toward night next day came back to Aunt Me's 
8th Went to Starksborrough to Polly s, Tefft, Chaffer's -- enjoyed the ride muchly up and down the hills, and over the clear shining stream's that came rushing and foaming down their rocky beds

1877
Sept 9th Attended the Baptist yearly meeting but enjoyed gazing at those glorious old hills, and woods, much better than the meeting 
10th Made a visit to Saxton Teffts --above Teffts (no fraud there) was delighted with the places felt as if my above my -- if loved ones were all with me -- there I could stay forever 
11th We cam back to Aunts -- 13 Went to Homers 
14th Homer took me to Irwin Rowley s stayed there untill the 17th Mrs Irwin carried me up to Peter Rowley s 
18th Peter's wife took me for a ride up to Lake view cemetery stoped in the village and got some Steroscopic views 
19th we visited at Mary Barnes's in Burlington village 
20th Made blue plum preserves at Peters
21st Ella (Peter's daughter) took me down to Wm Seymours stayed there untill the 24th Wm took me back to Irwins 
25th Mrs Singleton went with me to D Taggarts 
26th Visited Mrs Adeline Tracy -- and Mrs Newell in - eve - 
27th Went riding with Irwin down on the Lake shore road, through Lover's Lane and on to Shelburn point the scenery was most delightful -- in all the years I lived in VT I never knew there was such lovely places within five or six miles of us, it seems a perfect paradise on earth, a continual feast for the eye 
28th Irwin took me back to Homers they were gone from home went back to Shelburn falls to Simon Curry's and stayed untill most night then went to Homer's 
29th Was quite sick all day and all night 
Oct 2d got back to Aunt Me's -- 4th raining dismal day 
5th quite cold and windy 6th clear and pleasant 
7th Had slight frost the first of the season 
10th Romilla came and stayed all day and all night then I went home with her and stayed two nights -- it rained nearly all the time I was there

1877
Oct 15th Still raining 14th Visited the old burying place where my Grand parents -- my Mother and many other dear relatives lie mouldering, while we go marching on the same downward road 
17th Lucy Church came and made us her farewell visit 
18th Bid farewell to the old Homestead on the hill -- looked probably for the last time on the blue mountains in the distance and the nearer hills gorgeous in Autumnal splendor  we went to Homers 21 I went to Uncle Ralph's - Menda and Mary went with me down to the river that I so longed to see and where I had spent so many happy hours in my young days but even the river was changed it looked much narrower and the old mill and bridge was gone, the dark green hemlocks and pine trees all cut down -- all looked desolate and dreary we went on a little farther to take a look at uncle Clark s old place and then back home -- next morning went back to Homer's cold north wind -- snow on the mountains the peak of old camel white took a ride with Homer up on the north road and around by the village 
Oct 23 Left Shelburn at half past four Aunt with me we arrived at Brushes Mills at half past ten found Harrison waiting for us at the Depot -- 24th it rained all day 
25 Snowed all day 26 visited Alpheus Conger very pleasant but so cold the snow did not melt off 
28th Went to Church to hear Harrison preach -- still cold -- snow covers the ground
29th Left Brushes Mills at ten o clock got to Wattertown about dark to Syracuse at half past nine stoped at the Globe Hotel got up a three in the morning waited in the Depot untill half 
Oct 30
past five then started for Buffalo where we arrived at 11 in morning 
31st Miserable cold rain Nov 1st started to go to Niagara falls but was too late for the train -- in afternoon went to Forrest Lawn Cemetery cold chilly day

1877
Nov 2d Awful storm of rain and high wind water all over Buffalo flats so it looks just like the Lake
3d left Buffalo at seven in the morning arrived at Alfreds at half past 5 eve at Collins Ohio 
5th rain and snow -- 6th went to Mr Deans -- and to Mr Perkins Merrill 
7th Left Collins at 8 in morning got to Chicago 8 at night found Will Warswick and Etta at the Depot waiting for me 
8 - 9 rain - snow - cold and unpleasant 
Nov 20th I went to Chicago for the first time since I got home from VT stayed all night at Clarenda's next day it rained all day I trudged around all day in the mud then came home 
26th The sun has not shone for nearly a week has rained most all the time the roads are awful no travel only by those that are obliged to go 
Nov 28th Martha and Etta went to Chicago, very cold day mud froze up hard as a brick 
" 29th Thanksgiving very cold, Martha and I went  to Adalines to diner 
Dec 11th Very warm just like spring but the roads so bad no one can stir out have been having a little sick spell but am feeling better to day 
15th Rena and went to Chicago, warm comfortable day 
16th Still warmer Sam Etta and I dined at Corbetts on baked trout 
18th It rained most all day was dark and dismal but Ada Etta and Mrs Smart were all here and sewed for Martha as it was her birthday 
19th - 20th -- To warm we could hardly have a fire wanted the doors open 
22d Ada and I went to Chicago rained nearly all day very warm 
Dec 25 We all met at Sam's and had dinner and Supper dull raining day Ada stayed home for the first time since she moved away 
27th Still continues rainy and the mud is simply awful has not so bad for years 
1878
Jan 1st Clear beautiful day the first time the sun has shone for a long time Alonzo Hickok came and stayed all night with us last night went away in the morning

1878
Jan 1st We all went to Corbett s to Oyster supper the Geor's were there it turned cold in the night and snowed a very little 3d still colder 
5th A little more snow but soon got too cold to snow 
7th 8th Pretty cold -- ten degrees below zero -- 10th getting warmer 
11th just like a spring day 13th damp and Chilly Sam and Etta went to Chicago to Arthur's 
Jan 17th Margaret came down here and stayed untill the 20th very muddy 
22d turned cold and froze the all up Ada came over here the 16 to stay untill her rooms were painted and grained so was home when Maggie was here
21st Henry Hickok and his young wife came to Sam's and stayed two days 
27th Ada went back home weather very mild no sleighing yet 
29th Martha and I went to Chicago she had some teeth filled we went to Dunphy's and I stayed all night, came home next day 
31 Had quite a snow storm 
Feb 1st snowed fast all day and all night -- 2d Frank Miller moved in my house 
3d Clear pleasant day sleigh's have been flying and bell s gingling all day 
Feb 11th Sam Etta Josiphine and myself went to Leyden in sleigh found very bad sleighing drifted in some places, bare ground in others we called a few minutes at Willey's stoped at Hermans about half an hour and at Wm's long enough to get supper 
15 Martha and I called to see Mrs Porter
16th weather warm snow going off very fast mud coming on 
12th Arthur and his wife came out to Sam's to stay 
23 Will Warswick, commenced side walk in front of Lenox house 
28 Frank Miller colsomined my house front room dining room front bed room up stairs had front room papered 
March 3d Ada s baby born went there to stay with her 
Sunday March 10 George and Willie Rowley and Lucy and Eva all came down here to make a farewell call before going to Kansas it rained hard and is so muddy they  had a hard time to get here

1878
March 12th It has been very warm all through this month so far frogs singing three nights ago 
March 23 Rena's birthday very warm all day so we did not need a fire Thomas and Jenny Sam and Etta took supper with us and in the evening the wind changed very suddenly and blew a perfect gale and got very cold in a few minutes. Thomas and his wife were alarmed about their children and went home in a hurry 
24 real cold with slight flurries of snow
25 Martha Rena and I went to Chicago Rena and I stayed all night at Mr Hickok's they lived on the corner of Warren and Western Ave's 
April 8th Mrs Fitz Kitty and Corbett came out to Corbett's 10th they all came over to Etta s it was the first time Ada has been home since her baby was born 
13 sowed lettuce 17th planted snow flake potatoes 
20 Had pie plant pie -- 22 went to Mrs Thatcher's funeral it rained 
23 Went to bid Mrs Hastings Good By they soon start for Kansas 
25 It has rained almost continually the last week awful lot of water on ground 
May 1st planted blue potatoes Peas beets and peppers Frank -- trump Leonard came here 
3 - 4- 5 quite cold Frank went away as mysteriously as he came 
6 I went to Chicago, called to see Mrs Edwards 
14th Martha Rena and I went to Chicago to get hats 
16 cold miserable weather has been cold and wet all this month I have been sleeping in woolen blankets the last two weeks and under as many quilts as I did in winter

1878
May 19th Have had another awful rain but the weather is a little warmer have not been to Leyden this spring the roads have been unclear
23 Went to Centenial Hall to violin concert awful Tornado in Wisconsin
26 Sam and Etta went to Lombard -- Will and Martha went to Thomase's -- Richard Lucy the three children and Lura came down here -- Ada came to help me get dinner 
29 Miserable cold rain all day -- thought it would snow before morning but in the morning it cleared off and was a fine day though pretty cool Martha Rena and I went with Aunt Lucy and Josie to Rose Hill cemetery to Decoration 
31 a little warmer -- planted VT cucumber seeds 
June 1st Ada and Rena went to Chicago -- 2d rained all day 
3d Sam's folks moved down to Fred Priest's house 
8th Another cold miserable rain  -- Sam commenced cultivating potatos yesterday
13 I went to Chicago stayed all night to Pelten s -- called at Dunphy next day 
June 15 Sam Ett and I went to Chicago in wagon warmest day of the season
June 20 Ada Etta and I went to Leyden for the first time this spring I stayed untill the 23 when Richard Lucy and their three children came to our house and we all went over to Aunt Lucy s to eat strawberry supper 
25 Sister Dunphy came out here for the first time since my return from VT she stayed untill the 28th

1878
July 4th Our folks Arthurs and Miller's all took Pic nic dinner at Marthas then went to Turner Park for a ride came back and had supper 
10 Unity Church folks had a Pic nic at the Fidelia grounds which we all attended very comfortable day it had been excessively hot every day since the 4th -- 12th very hot had a heavy rain last night with much thunder 
13 - 14 - 15 - 16 - 17 -- Extremely hot weather ranging from 85 to 105 great many persons Sun struck in St Louis and other places Rena taken down with measles July 11th 1878 
July 17th Rena able to sit up --picked the last hand full cherries 
20th Another awful hot day 25 do but at night had a glorious good rain of which we were very much in need
Aug 1st Fannie sick with measles -- Allie just got over them 
4th Sam Etta Corbett and Ada went to Willeys had heavy rain 
5th Martha and I went down to Thomas Warswick -- got butter 
10th Martha Rena Allie and I all went up to Leyden left Rena to make a visit at uncle Wm's 
12 Sam and Etta went to Chicago brought Mrs Hickok and Flora home with them 
13 They went with me to Leyden after Rena -- called at Willey s had rain
21 Martha and I took Mrs Hickok and Flora home had Mr Hoards Buggy
25 Another heavy rain -- 29th Martha and I went down to Etta's to dinner it being her Birthday took our first ride in our new Buggy Ada and Rena went to Chicago 
Sept 3d Rena and I went to Chicago to see the Fireman's parade saw President Hays 
Sept 2d Laura came down here went with Sam and Ett to see the Fireman
Sept 4th Aunt Lucy -- Josie Mira from Wheaton Ada Etta and Mrs Smart all here to celebrate my 62d Birth day sewed Ada s delaine quilt

1878
Sept 8th It has been awful hot the past week, yellow fever raging terribly at the South Fred and Margaret came after Laura 
9th a little cooler -- picked second planting of string beans -- planted 22 July Will commenced picket fence in front of Carters this week 
Sept 14th Martha Rena and I went to Chicago left horse at Mr Hickok went down Town on Street cars had Allie s picture taken also Rena and Flora
Sept 18 Fannie s Birthday quilted Ada's Delaine quilt
" 19 The weather has been very hot the past four days they are cutting grass in Quicks field for the 2d or 3d time
Sept 22 Corbett and Ada went to Chicago called at Dunphys old George had been gone two weeks they do not know what has became of him 
25 Ada and I went to Chicago to Matson s got plated tea spoons for Ada, Martha and Etta - Wills watch chain it rained, hailed, thundered and wind blew terribly 
28 took Martha and Allie up to Wm s to stay a few days
30 Extremely hot went down to Warswicks got tomato s for Mrs Carter 
Oct 1st Ada and Ett went up to Leyden to bring Martha home visited Kate Williamson for the first time since they were all married
3d I went to Chicago got silver dessert spoon's for Ada teaspoons and watch for myself two plated dessert spoon for Martha 
5th Ada Rena and I went to Chicago had Fannie Photo taken called to see Sister D - 7th went with Sam to see the race ground and horses Corbett went to Cincinnatti came back the 7th 
8th Heavy rain with thunder and lightning
Oct 14 Martha and went to Leyden called at Uncle Wm s Mrs Napier Mr Willey -- Goodyears --Betsy Draper's and Mr Bell s very warm day with high wind

1878
Oct 15 We all went to Sopha to quilting -- dark -- damp -- chilly day 
16 - 17 - 18 - pretty cold had first frost 18th 20th warm again 
21 Martha went to Chicago and bought her dining room stove 
24 Martha and I went to Chicago in Buggy drove down on Milwaukie Ave stoped a Sister Dunphys cold chilly day 
25 I went to Chicago on cars quite a comfortable day -- 26 commenced to sleep in blankets 
27th regular winter day ground white with snow which commenced following yesterday 
30th cold rain with flurries of snow -- 31 Sam and Arthur got each a barrel of Apples 
Nov 1st Clear pleasant day but high wind
2d Etta went to Chicago to stay over Sunday with Laura she came back the 4th brought Emma Hickok with her she stayed untill the 7th
8 Margaret and Mira came down here Nov 18 Mary Jane Mathews buried to day -- dark and gloomy with a little rain 
Nov 24 Aunt Lucy Josie and I dined at Sam's Fred Willey came down here with the news that his old uncle was dead the next day George and Laura came down to engage Mr Powers to attend the funeral 
27th Sam took the Preacher up to Willey road pretty good but cold raw wind 
28 Thanksgiving very fine pleasant day all our folks except myself had their turkey dinner at Sam's I was not well enough to go -- but had my dinner with Mr Carter's folks 
Nov 29th Will and Martha went to Chicago with Sam in waggon very comfortable day we have not had any snow except what we had the latter part of Oct have had fine weather most of this month

1878
Dec 1st rain -- 6th Went to Unity Church New England supper (unclear
7th Ada and Etta went to Chicago Ada got herself a cloak and they both got Alpacca black dresses 8th quite a snow storm there was no wind with as is usual with us but is evenly spread enough to make fine sleiging
Dec 10 Rena and I went to Chicago got her cloak and dress 
12 I went down to Etta's and stayed untill the next night the two Mrs Churchill and Mr Churchill were there to supper 
14 -- 15 heavy snow storm weather mild the best sleighing have had for years -- 16 Martha and Rena went to Chicago Ada's baby quite sick 
18th Martha s Birthday we spent the day making Rena new brown dress more snow and pretty cold -- 19 - 20 ten degrees below zero 
21 more snow 22 very cold our fine sleiging nearby unclear as the snow is drifting badly 
22 very cold and stormy a Miss Chapin preached at Unity Church but so cold we did not any of us go 
23 - 24 -- very cold Thermometer ranging from ten to 15 below 
25 Not quite so cold -- Aunt Lucy Josiphine and all of our family had turkey dinner and Oyster supper at Marthas Sam and Etta stayed all night and we had a very pleasant time Allie went home with them the next day and stayed untill Sunday (29th) 30 very cold day 
31st weather more mild sleighing very fine -- bright moonlight evenings -- every one trying to enjoy themselves this last day of the year 1878 -- not thinking of the thousands that have passed away since one year ago to day Corbett has gone out to Patterson's

1879
Jan 1st
Sam Etta and myself went to Austin to attend George Dunphy's wedding it was quite a grand affair for common folks had a very nice supper, they all stayed in the eve and had a jolly good time -- the weather was quite mild during the day but turned cold before we started home Sam froze his fingers and Etta got a bad cold it grew colder and colder all night the wind blew furiously Ada and the children were at Martha's and had to stay all night Will went over and made a fire for her in the morning and Mr Churchill carried them home in sleigh Corbett was gone to Rochelle to visit Patterson's 
2d 3d two awful cold days Thermometer ranging from 16 to 24 below zero have had no such weather since New Year's day 1864 
5th Nothing to say only very cold 
11th First comfortable day we have had since the 1st Rena and Fannie went to Chicago to Fitz Patrick's with Corbett in sleigh 
11th Etta first went to consult Dr. Tope he prescribed cod liver oil 
12th very fine day I rode down to Etta with Mr Churchill in sleigh 
14 Martin Hickok came out here -- 15th furious snow storm Martin went down to Sam's and stayed all night 18th he went home 
21st Mrs Hickok and Sister Dunphy came out stayed two days Martin came after them and brought Flora she stayed untill 28th when Sam carried her home in the

1879
28th
mean time we had the usual Jan thaw and our fine sleighing is nearly spoiled the weather for a week past has been just like spring (Sunday 26) Martha Rena Flora and myself were down to Sam's to dinner -- George Willey Margaret and Mira were down here Sunday (19th) the girls stayed all night at Adalines George stayed here at Martha's -- Ett and Sam stayed the night before 
Feb 3d Ada and Etta had comforter's made at Ada's 
7th the weather has been quite mild for a week past but there are big snow banks yet across the road where we get it to do our washing -- 8th Martha and Rena went to Town 
9th I went to Ada s to stay with the children while she went to hear the little Welch Preacher -- 
12th Went to Hanson's paid taxes -- 13 went over to Ada s stayed all day and all night she and Martha went to hear the Tennessean s sing but could not get in the Hall was so crowded it was awful cold -- almost as cold as the fore part of Jan 
14th Mr Churchill s horse got her leg broken and had to be killed 
16 weather mild with a little soft snow George Dunphy and wife came out to Sam's -- 17 I went down to visit with Georges wife 
20th Mr and Mrs Smart moved in the house with Arthur's folks -- a little more snow at night 
21 Attended Walter Hubbard's funeral -- 19th went to see Dr Tope about my back -- Corbett, Ada, and Rena went to Centenial Hall to hear a woman read

1879
Feb 25 Rose Kettlestring and her sister Hannah and Mrs Annie Warswick were here to tea it was a drizly day a little snow and a little rain which froze and made it very slippery, and it turned very cold in the night the wind blew a perfect gale and I took a severe cold and had a very sore throat -- 26-27 very cold with a little snow
March 1st mild and pleasant 
3d Ada came home and left the children with me she and Martha went to hear the Tennesseans sing Fannie stayed two nights with me (Sunday 2d) Sam and Etta went in Town to visit George Dunphy and wife
5th they went in again to trade 
Thursday 6th I went down to Sam s and stayed untill Sunday (9th)
9th Sam and Corbett went to Bloomingdale 
10th very warm for the time of year birds and frogs singing Sister Dunphy came out here to stay awhile 
Wed 12 turned cold in the night wind blew furiously Martha went to Chicago stayed all night at George Willey s found Margaret there and had a visit with her came home Thursday (13)
14th very cold with flurries of snow -- Sat 15th went down to Etta s very cold
19th Sister D and I visited Mrs Brewster
20th We went over to Ada's and stayed all day and all night to stay with the children while she went to the dentist to have her teeth filled
Sat 22 Sister D went home

1879
Tuesday April 1st Election day -- 2d quite a heavy snow storm
3d very boisterous froze hard last night and this morning Churchill had blankets on his horses
4th Still pretty cold 5 very fine day snow all gone
6 warm and pleasant Martha gone to Unity Church 
9 very heavy rain -- Fannie and Lutie both sick  Lutie had convulsions -- 15 cold with north wind most of the time the past week 
18 Pleasant comfortable day Martha cleaned Pantry
April 24 Mr Carters folks moved away to Austin and Sam's moved in -- have not had any rain since the 9th 
Apr 30 The weather has been very warm the past two weeks so we did not need fire much of the time - Thermometer up to 90 two day currants all in blossom cherries just beginning to come out 
May 1st Last night it turned cold had frost 
2d still colder froze ice 1/4 of an inch in thicknes
3d Rena went to Chicago to Mr Hickok s rode in with Mr Flanders and I went on the cars stayed all night at Mr Willey s next day went to hear D Thomas preach -- in the afternoon George took Mira and I to Mr Peltons -- Ida and Tirza Tanner s -- next went to Mr Hickok s and stayed all night came next day (Apr 6th)
7th pretty cold weather for this time of year -- Magnus unclear and hay with cow and calf burned while they were away to the funeral of his wife

1879
May 10th - 11th - 12 very warm for this time of the year
11th Corbett, Ada, Sam and Etta went to Chicago to Turner Hall Concert
13 I went to Unity Church Strawberry festival took Fannie with me 
Sunday 18th Richard, Lucy, Eva -- Nellie -- and Maud all down here Aunt Lucy gave Eva a gold watch -- weather quite cool 
22d Rena and I went to Methodist Strawberry festival
25th Heavy rain which was badly needed also much thun-der and lightning struck the spire of the Episcopal Church doing it considerable damage 
May 29th Margaret came this way from Chicago and I went home with her and stayed four days -- Ada and Etta came after me June 2d the weather had been very warm untill Sat 31 it turned awful cold and remained so the 1st and 2d of June 
June 5th Martha and I went to Chicago to the Home Fair Martha bought her oil stove paid 8 dollars for it -- I went to see Dr Fisher about my back he gave me some medicine and a Belladonna Plaster -- drove Doll and left her at Mr Hickok Mr and Mrs Stanley Sanford were there also Mrs Dunphy 
June 6th very cold had heavy frost thousands of Tomato plants killed also corn bean and potato tops 
8th quite warm again -- 14 heavy rain (very warm so we slept with only a sheet over us) 19th cold - Corbett and Ada went to Leyden 16 so cold we slept under two quilts and a woolen blanket had frost but not enough to injure things much 17th not quite so cold - Etta and

1879
I went down to Norass's got strawberries for 6 cts a quart when we got home found Richard -- Lucy -- Eva -- Nellie and Maud -- June 19th Ada -- Etta -- and Hattie Churchill went to Chicago in Buggy drove Corbett s horse 
21st Another heavy rain storm -- Allie has been a couple of days had the Dr (Tope) 22d We all went to Aunt Lucys to our annual strawberry feast, Nersimers folks all there also and I think we devoured more than a half bushel of berries -- Rena went home with Richard's folks -- 
24 Sam and Ett went to Chicago with Cherries only got a dollar and half a bushel -- their cow had a calf the same day 
26th Martha and I went to Chicago left horse at Hickok s had bad luck all day - it rained -- and we had our fill straps stolen -- and lost Martha's Parasol coming home did not do anything we intended came home with the blues 
27 It rained very hard -- 28 more rain
" George Dunphy and wife came out to get cherries
Sund 29 very pleasant but roads muddy 
June I went to Leyden after Rena took Allie with me 
July 3d awful hot day - Corbett and Ada went to Chicago to take Kitty Fitz Patrick home was out in a very hard thunder shower -- turned cold in the night 
July 4th quite a cool day but clear and pleasant Rena and I went to Leyden Pic nic in Robinson woods Corbett Sam Ada and Ett went to Central Park Martha stayed at home very dull time all around

1879
July 5th we all picked and canned Cherries 
" 6th Awful hot day Corbett Ada Sam and Etta went to Albert Hickok's and Lincoln Park had an awful heavy rain with thunder lightning and wind they did not get home untill ten o clock P.M turned cold -- 7th rained all day -- 
10th - 11th - 12th awful hot day Flora went home 12th Sister D came same day 
July 13th George Willey came out here Mrs D rode home with him
" 14 Extremely hot -- 15 hottest day of the season -- from 95-to-100
" 16 a little more comfortable cherries lasted untill today 
" 17 I went to Chicago stayed all night at Willey's turned so cold that Laura was chilled through with her water proof when she was riding in from the country and her brother wore an overcoat 
18 Just warm enough to be comfortable I came home and Etta went in to stay with Laura a few days while Sam and Jean Pebble were gone on their expedition they started the 15th 
22 had a little rain
23 Martha Rena and I went to Lincoln Park to the Episcopal Pic-nic -- Sam and Etta got home the same day
29 Sam and Etta started for West Creek Ind -- Martha went as far as Chicago with them 
July 31st Martha and Will went to Chicago in Buggy left old Dolly at Mr Hickok's and went down Town on street car Will bought him a 90 dollar gun and paid 8 dollars more for case 
Aug 1st Aunt Lucy Martha and went to Leyden to see Uncle Wm he has been sick several weeks -- it was the last time we saw him Martha stayed all night and went to see the crazy folks dance

1879
Aug 2d Sam and Etta got home from West Creek 
" 3d Will and Allie went up to Leyden after Martha and Richard's folks came down with them and took old Dick home with them (had a slight shower)
7th I went to Chicago to get wall paper for Etta s bed room Corbett and co went off to Fox Lake for pleasure excursion came back the 11th - 15th quite cool 17th much cooler sister D came out last night 
Aug 18th Mrs D Martha and I went down to Jenny Warswick s
" 26 Martha Rena Mrs Payne and her girls Mrs Arnold and her girls and myself all went to the Foundling s home to see the babies 
28th The weather has been very dry and hot for the last week or two Anson came to see us to day he was on his way home from VT where he had been to see his Mother who is not expected to live he only stayed with us one night last Sunday 24th Sister D Rena and I went to Camp Meeting stayed all night at Willey s -- Sat night and Sunday night 
Aug 29th Etta had quilting that Mrs Smart made for Sam had eleven quilters and did not get it half done weather very warm 
Sept 2d Uncle Wm died -- was buried the 3d it turned cold rained a little in the morning so cold had to wear cloaks and thick shawls 
4th finished Etta's quilt to celebrate my birth - day Mrs D went back to Chicago this morning 
Sept 10th Etta and I went to Chicago in Buggy left Doll at Willey s 
Sept 20th Mrs Mulligan and Clark Farewell s wife and three children came Mrs M so sick had the Dr

1879
Sept 19th I took Laura home (she had been staying with Ett a few days) brought Margaret home with me to go to Aurora
23 Mrs Mulligan and companions went back to Chicago Martha went to Leyden to take Margaret home and brought Jenny Harris home with her to sew for her -- rained very little 
Sept 25 quite cool last night had the first frost hard enough to kill tomato vines 
27 - 28th - 29th very warm weather 30th much hotter
Oct 1st Ada and Rena went to Leyden to take Jenny Harris home they got some grapes at Mr Gray's very hot Trermometer 85 in the without any fire 104 in the sun--has been very dry for some time 
Oct 2d had quite a hard shower Churchills new cistern about half full more rain than we have had since July 6th the day our folks went to Lincoln Park 
Sept Corbet and Ada Rena and I went to Central Park took Mrs D there to go back to Chicago she came out last night 
Sept Ada Rena and I went to the Exposition - Ada bought pail (of butter 16 cts lb on water street)
Sept 17 we all went to Mrs Merrill's to quilting Laura was there she came down here last Sunday (14th)
Sept 18th Fannie's birthday we were all over there to supper Laura too 
Oct 5th an extremely hot day -- Sam and Ett went up to the asylum to ball 
Oct 8th Ada s birthday she and her children were here and Ett came and we had Tea all by ourselves as in former times -- very hot every day 
9th all I can say is awful hot never knew such weather in Oct
15th Martha went to the Exposition -- weather still continues hot Tremometer ranging between 80 and 90 in shade 100 and upwards in sun

1879
Oct 16 Another very hot day but it rained at night and turned cool
18th Rena and I went to Chicago stayed over Sunday at Mr Hickok's came home Monday
Oct 21 Lucy came down here and she and Martha went in Town stayed all night at Peltons when they came back she stayed here all night Eva and Nellie came after her it was real cold -- wind north 
24th So cold we slept in woolen blankets with two quilts and comforter
27th - 28th continues cold -- 29th I went to Evanston to visit Newells folks I stayed two nights then went back to Chicago it had got so cold that I really suffered going about doing my shoping went up to Willey s (called at Mrs Edwards's) and stayed all night came home the 1st day of Nov it was regular winter weather and at night we had quite a snow storm 
2-3-4 very cold for this time of year the river frozen over -- 
5th Some warmer Martha and Rena went to Leyden to get belle fleur apples (but did get them)
6th quite a comfortable day Mrs Smart and Ell went to Chicago Ett got her blue hood -- 7th-8th very warm took off woolen blanket seems just like spring 8th Ada and Rena went to Chicago to have the children s pictures taken but Lutia was so scared they could not take her's or do anything with her 
9th had a shower last night but it is quite pleasant to day
10th 11th very warm need no fires -- 12th a little cooler had a heavy rain last night and it has been showery to day Corbett and Sam went to Chicago to see the Grant display very muddy
13th Martha Etta and I went to Mrs Hubbards to sew for her 
19th - 20th very cold -- 21 - 22 a little more comfortable -- Arthur has been very sick for a week with Diptheria

1879
Nov 25th Poor little Hattie Hanscom died to day of Diptheria
" 26th It rained nearly all day -- we have got everything all ready for Thanksgiving but am afraid we shall have no one come to help us eat turkey 
27th We all got together at Sam's to eat dinner but it rained so hard that Richard s folks did not come they started but the road was so bad they went back home so they thought they would have somebody an sent for Mr and Mrs Hanson and Mrs Gangler Rose Kettlestring and her sister Mertie came and we had quite a merry time after all -- Ada and her children stayed all night -- 28 it rained then snowed turned cold and froze up 
Dec 1st Martha and Ada went to Chicago quite mild day
" 2d Had some rain -- 3d Cloudy dark day
" 4th Etta, Mrs Churchill, and Hattie went to Chicago
" 5-6-7-8th very mild and very muddy
" 9th Rained nearly all day 10th turned cold and froze hard 
" 13th I went to Chicago to make a farewell visit to Alonzo's they expect to start for Kansas soon 14th Alonzo, Mariette and I called at Willeys on May street at Pelton s and G Dunphy s to see the twins 
15th Pretty cold I ran around all say came home on the 6-o clock train
16-17-18th quite cold with a little snow 19th more mild 
Dec 23 Etta went to Chicago and got her furs 
" 24 It rained and froze so it is so slippery one can hardly walk 
" 25 All our folks and Walter Kettlestring and wife, Arthur and wife Mr and Mrs Smart Mr and Mrs Churchill with all the children belonging to them met at Sam's to get their presents from the Christmas tree they had some nice presents and a good many small ones for the children but no one could

1879
feel very merry as we had just heard of the death of Mr Austin s little girl who died very suddenly with Diptheria a number of others have died and a good many are sick it is a sad time to many Arthur's and Corbett's folks Mr & Mrs Smart eat Christmas dinner at Etta's -- Martha cooked a turkey and had no one to help eat it Rena Fannie Allie and I took our dinner in my room by ourselves -- very cold day 10 degrees below zero 
26th Not quite so cold -- 28th very comfortable day -- Jo Huett, Lucy, Eva, Nellie and Maud came down here in sleigh
Dec 31 Clear pleasant day Ada and her children came over Rena drew Lutie on her sled quite good sleighing on the sidewalk but not much in the road -- thus endeth the year 1879
1880
Jan 1st Sam and Etta went to Arthur's to spend the day Martha expected Richards folks here to eat turkey dinner but they did not come so we had it all to ourselves had no company but Fannie Ada came a little while in afternoon weather fine but roads bad
Jan 2d Clear beautiful day more like spring than anything else blue jay's trying to sing but dont know how -- snow nearly all melted so it is quite sloppy 4th rained hard all day and all night but to day is warm and pleasant went to Ada s to turkey dinner they expected Mr Patterson but he did not come Milly is out there with him 
Jan 5 Etta and Rose went to Chicago and bought Cloaks
7th I went to Chicago with Etta she took her cloak and changed it it was so dark and foggy that we could hardly see to do any thing
9th poor Mr Lenox got so badly hurt by the cars that he died to day 
11th Mr Lenox buried Mr Gillingham attended the funeral in Chicago

1880
Jan 18 We have had lovely weather the past week so warm we hardly needed fire Sam and Etta went to George Dunphy s and to Mr Hickok's found them about ready to start for Kansas
21 rained all day roads in a horrible condition
Thursday (22d) another young Corbett come to Town -- weather colder
Jan 25 Mr Gibson preached for the first time in Unity Church Alonzo and Mariette came out here yesterday Alonzo's last visit
28 raining and freezing at the same time -- 29 Alonzo Henry and Charlie started for Kansas -- 30-31 coldest weather we have had -- from the 23 to the 27 was uncommonly warm so we slept with only one quilt and a blanket over us -- Feb 8th we have had cold weather all this month so far but no snow
Feb 11 Martha went to Chicago it rained most all day she stayed all night -- 17th I went to Chicago and Emma Hickok came out here it rained at night but turned to snow and froze hard before morning
21 Emma went home Rena went with her -- we all went to hear Brooke Herford preach has been cold all the week -- Another of Behering s children died last night also Mrs Beilenberg of Ridge land
Feb 22 Went to Unity Church to hear Mr Lang of Jolliett
" 25 I went to Chicago to see Emma before she left for Kansas sayed all night at Elliots went down Town to do shoping went to Willey s stayed all night Margaret and I called to see Mrs Everett on Des plaines street it was a cold raw misty miserable day but very warm the two days before
Feb 29th it rained all the afternoon yesterday but in the evening it very suddenly turned cold the wind blew furiously from the N.W and froze the mud all up in a hurry -- we slept with more bed clothes over us than any time during the winter -- Emma and Julia started for Kansas

1880
March 1st quite mild -- 3d rained nearly all day
4th high wind and turned cool 7th very cold wind Etta went to Unity Church in the morning to Arthurs away north of Chicago Ave in the afternoon to Church again in the eve and made herself sick she took a bad cold and cough is bad
9th Had quite a little snow storm but it soon melted off 
10th Clear but a cold east wind Ada came over here for the first time since baby Clara was born Theresa brought the baby Josephine went to Chicago last Monday and sent money to Heman to buy a cow but they did buy one (used the money to live on)
March 11 I went over to Mrs Walter Kettlestring s stayed to tea for the first time snow all gone 12th Mrs Hickok came out here
18th Concrt at Centenial Hall I stayed with Ada s children so she could go 
21 Corbett carried Fannie and Lutie to Chicago in carriage
March 15th Richard Lucy and Nellie came down here
20 very fine day wind N.W. 22 pleasant warm day 
23d-24th 25th cold freezing weather with flurries of snow
26 a little warmer 31 had rain -- Allie has been quite sick the past 3 days
April 1st I went to Chicago from there out to Maplewood to see George Kline to hear about Hemans folks --very pleasant day 
2d It rained 3d Clarenda and Flora came out to visit us went back same day
8th hitched up Old Doll in Buggy for the first time this year
9th Had a new cistern put down on the Gurly place 
Apr 10th Old Mr Porter died to day -- weather cold sprinkling of snow 
12 Martha Mrs Hickok attended Mr Porter s funeral -- cold with awful high wind blew -- dust blew so one could hardly see 
14th Hot with very high wind -- thunder shower at night lightning struck a tree near Fred Tryster's barn and shivered it from top to bottom

1880
April very fine day -- still, cool, and delightful, I went to see Mrs Porter
16 quite a heavy rain 18th awful Hurricane in various parts of the west whole, small Town destroyed in Missouri great many lives lost nearly a hundred killed in Marshfield MO over a hundred dwellings destroyed -- many houses blown down in Wis and a number of lives lost -- it was an awful hot day 
19th turned awful cold -- 21 Martha and I went to Chicago paid Norwood taxes -- went up to Willey on May street had dinner there 
27th Martha took Allie to Chicago and had his Photo taken 
28th Mrs Hickok went back to Chicago
29th I went to Chicago with Corbett  Mrs King -- and Mrs Fay to hear a lecture by Mr Hazard from Wheaton -- subject unruly boys, he did not do the subject justice at all it was not worth 2 cts, could have done better myself
May 4th Ada went to Chicago for the first time since baby was here Etta went with her
5 Fred Smith planted potatos for Martha
6th Mira Willey came here -- weather has been delightful the last week 
May 8th Heavy rain with much thunder and Lightning -- Mira and I stayed all night at Corbett's on account of the showers
11th I went to Chicago called to see Mrs Allen in the house where Mrs Dunphy has a room -- Etta went to Leyden carried Mira home and brought Laura back with her -- (Etta stayed all night )
12 Laura went in Town -- 15 Martha and I set each a grape vine Sam and Ett went up to Richards after dark 9 o clock when they got there
Sunday 16th A beautiful day Mr Sage preached at Unity but I was not able to go 
17 had first box strawberries (14 cts) -- Etta Rena and I went to Centenial Hall to Unity Church strawberry festival very warm

1880
May 19th had a heavy shower then it turned cool 20th too cold for comfort
May 27th Sam's house that he bought moved on the Gillingham lot 
29 Pretty cool rained all the afternoon
30th Martha and Ada quite sick 
31st Rainy day Lutie quite sick
June 1st very pleasant Aug - 2d cool with showers 
7th Martha and I went to Chicago got wall paper for her front room and front chamber 10th papered the bed room it took almost four double rolls of paper very hot day 
11th Richard Lucy - Eva - Nellie - Maud - and Eddie came down to Etta s awful hot -- 12-13-14th had rain turned cool
15 So cold needed fire to be comfortable -- slept with with two quilts and woolen blankets over us the wet cold weather has caused our cherries to burst so they will be nearly half wasted commenced using them yesterday -- Ada went to Chicago last Wed (9th) got the children's hats
19th Sam and Etta went to Chicago stayed all night at Willey's Ett got her Cashmere dress 
20th delightful day Martha went to Unity Church but the preacher had gone -- have not had a pleasant sunday for several weeks -- 21-22 Ett had a dress maker from Austin 
26 Sister Dumphy came out here 28 she went back and I went with her got Rena Lawn dress cool fine day
29 picked currants for Jenny Warswick
June 30th Linda Pierce Fisher called to see us she was married one week ago they were on the way to McPherson County Kansas

1880
July 1st Had three or four showers I went down to Arthur s between showers have had rain quite often -- our currants are all rotting
July 4th Corbett and family went to Leyden -- Sam and Ett went to Lombard to old Mr Churchill s -- rained at night I went to (Congregational Church)
5th As the 4th came on Sunday the 5th was celebrated Corbetts family Arthur s Martha s also all took dinner at Sam's and myself and Mr and Mrs Smart -- and then Sam's, Corbetts & Arthurs folks and Rena all went to Central Park for a ride and also to Humbolt in the eve we went up to Woods to see them dance in the door yard 
July 7th Martha and Rose went to Chicago -- 8th Rose started for Iowa in the rain picked the last pint of cherries -- 9-10-11 very hot weather 11 Corbett Ada Rena and I went to the woods to get gooseberries but it was so hot and the musquitos so thick that we did not stay long to get any 
12 Ada went to Chicago -- Sam and Etta went in their Buggy with the horse that Dr Lewis used to own 
13th Another awful hot day Thermometer 112 in the sun 96 in shade 
14-15 a little more comfortable -- 14 Martha and Jenny Warswick went up to Willey s
15 George Dunphy s wife three sisters and five children visited Etta it turned real cool at night 
16-17-18 -- Delightful days just warm enough and just coole enough to be comfortable 
18 had a fine shower in the night 19 very cool
20th I went to Chicago had another cold night almost cold enough for frost 
22 Corbett and family started for Iowa 
24 Rena and I went up to Willey s for the first since Nov 1st 1879 when we got home found Sister Dunphy here 
25 Sam and Ett went to Riverside took their dinner and stayed all night 
July 30 Allie s birth day we went to Central Park to Mr Quick s Pic-nic Mrs D and I went down Town -- fine day

1880
July 31 We were all at Mrs Brewster's to tea except Ada and her children 
Aug 1st awful hot day -- 2d-3d so cold had to sleep with two quilts over us took Mrs D down to Maywood to do some work for Mrs Steele
4th She and I went up to Richards -- called at Willey's 
Aug 6th Ada and family got home from Iowa -- weather fine 
11th Martha and Etta went up to Richards took Rena to make her vacation visit 
13th took Sister Dunphy to Central Park for her to go back to Chicago Sister Brewster went with us -- 15 Sam and Ett went up to Willey s and Richard's and brought Rena home 
16th I went to Chicago to see the Knight Templars -- saw Forepaugh s circus parade the streets 
17th Corbett, Ada, Sam, Etta, Laura, Martha, Arthur and wife all went together in waggon to see the Templar parade
18th Martha Rena and I went to the troting Park to see the Templar drill and hear the music
17th 18th were two awful hot days the hottest of the season
19th had a fine shower 21 quite cool 
22 We expected Eva and Nellie down here but they did not come and we all went to Aunt Lucy s to tea to celebrate Josie's 38th birthday
23-24 awful hot again had a good shower the 24th
25th I went to Chicago to look at some sewing Machines -- went to Clarenda's and had dinner -- found Mrs Hickok and Flora there -- there is great quantities of fruit in the City especially peaches -- and Plums small baskets 25 cts
27th Ada took me up to Willey's to make my annual visit got 10 gallons vinegar -- it commenced to rain that night and rained all the next day (Sunday) and Monday - Tuesday was fair in the forenoon -- in the afternoon Maggie and I

1880
Aug -- went over to Mrs Napier's but could not stay as there was a big shower coming so we hurried back as fast as we could just got in the house when the rain began to pour and I never saw it rain harder and the lightning and thunder was awful and it rained all the rest of the time I was there so could not go to Richards at all 
Sept 2d Etta came after in the rain me with Sam's horse the mud was so deep it seemed as if we would never get through -- old Doll could never got us home -- I called to see Jenny Mc Gawn poor girl she is nothing but a mere skeleton will soon be through with this world 
Sept 3d It has cleared off at last but is terribly hot -- pieced a quilt while I was at Willey s
Sept 4th Had my Delaine bed quilt quilted
Sunday 5th very hot day went to Unity Church in the forenoon and to Austin in the afternoon to George Dunphy baby s funeral 
6th Had rain and it turned cool -- 8th-9th -- almost cold enough for frost 
11th first frost of the season -- 12 Sam and Corbett went up to Willey s 
15th We have had cold nights for nearly a week have slept under as many bed clothes as we did in winter -- Mrs Hickok and Flora came out here last Friday (10th) Ada went to Chicago 
14th Martha went to the exposition -- Jenny Warswick and Uncle Leonard Perry went with her -- uncle came last night 13th only stayed one night 
Sept 17th Mrs Hickok and I went up to Richard's got cucumbers 
18th Fannie's Birthday Etta made a party for her had ten little girls to supper -- Flora and Rena got up an entertainment in the eve for them it rained so hard that Corbett Ada their children Anna Warswick Tilly and Lilly Scales all stayed all night -- it rained most all the next day so Ada and the children did not go home till most night we were glad it rained so she could stay and make us a visit

1880
Sept 20th very cool with high wind from the North West 
" 23 Mrs Hickok and Flora went back to Chicago they have probably made us their last visit as they expect soon to go to Kansas
25 Rena and I went to Chicago to Exposition went to Willey s stayed two nights -- then went to Elliots to say Good By to Mrs Hickok and Flora -- it turned cold and rained Sunday (they would start the 29th) when we were at Willey s I took such a bad cold was not able to do much of any thing for three or four days after I got home 
Sept 30 We had awful heavy rain storm with terrible thunder and the lightning demolished the Hancock pole over which we were greatly rejoiced
Oct 2d Etta and I attended Jenny McGown's funeral  
" 3d Sun It commenced to rain last eve and rained all night and all day to day 
Sept 28 Eva came down here with Corbett to make a visit she and Ett and Rena went to Central Park and to Haas Park cemetery then Richards folks came after her because Jenny was dead 
Oct 7th Mrs Pelton Mrs West and Martha Meacham and two children came out here and stayed all night they all went back to Chicago next day Sat Mrs Meacham came out to Oak Park stayed all night at Gyrus Meacham s came to our house next day stayed all night and I took her to May wood
Oct 12th Mrs Smart commenced house keeping in her new house
" 13th Martha went to the Exposition took Allie with her 
" 15 Martha Allie and I went up to Willeys it rained awful hard when we were coming home we got wet as drowned rats it turned cold and the wind blew a perfect gale all day and night it snowed a little and was a regular winter night so had to get out woolen blankets and and comforters

1880
Oct 17th cold and windy with flurries of snow 
" 20th Weather continues cold -- 21st Minstrel entertainment at Centenial Hall Rena and I stayed with Ada children so she could go -- Sunday 24 Corbett Ada and the children went to Fitz Patrick s
23d George Dunphy and wife came out to Sam's to stay over Sunday
25 Anna Warswick moved into Brown s house next day moved in Schraders -- had a little rain 26th Great Hubbul in camp 
Oct 31 Martha Allie and I went up to Richards they had got their new organ -- roads good and day warm and fine 
Nov 1st 2d very warm pleasant days -- 3d I went to Chicago called at Elliots to see if I could hear from Hickok s went to Peltons and stayed all night called at Ladore Tanner's to hear about Sister D they did not know where she was 
6th Weather cold had our first snow storm but not a very big one and it nearly all went off during the next day 
7th very pleasant morning Rena hitched up old Doll and took the children for a ride but it grew cold afternoon 
8th comfortable day Mrs Wade came over to have Martha do some stitching on her Machine -- Martha s Chudduck dress got Nov 3d
9th Martha went in Chicago got Rena School dress
10th Turned cold with very high wind
16th Mr Robbins and Ruth Westerman came here and stayed untill the 19th has been very cold for three or four days with flurries of snow 22d Ada went to Chicago Etta and I got looking glass and carpet to cover the other one stayed with the children -- Martha and I attended Old Mrs Porters funeral the poor old woman is out of the way at last
21 awful cold day wind blew a perfect gale all day and all night

1880
Nov 25th our lives have all been spared to see another Thanksgiving day for which I hope we were truly thankful but we most always have something to feel dissatisfied about we all had an invitation to go to Richards -- but Sam and Ett had already been invited to go to Arthur's -- Martha had asked Anna Warswick and child-ren to dine with her -- Corbett lent his horse for the day think-ing it would be too cold to take the children so far but it come off warm the roads were good and they might have gone as well as  not so they stayed home alone -- one of Anna s children was sick so she could not come to Martha's -- Rena went down to Mrs Jenny Warswick's to spend the day -- Will Martha and I had a turkey all to ourselves and eat it in profound silence - so it was a pretty dull Thanksgiving after all 
26th We were very much surprised by a visit from Homer Irish and his cousin Wm Irish they had been to Iowa to visit relatives were on their way back to VT only stayed with us one night could not be persuaded to stop any longer as they had got so many visits to make before they got home Anna Warswick moved in her little house to day 
29th quilted Fannie's little Cashmere quilt Rena went to see Panorama of Pilgrim's progress
Dec 1st Clear beautiful day 2d fine warm day Martha went to Chicago
3d I called to see Mrs Furbeck mild comfortable day
4th Foggy and misty wish it would rain as the cisterns are many of them dry 
5th It rained last night enough so we got a bbl of water then it turned cold enough to freeze the hair off a dog and the wind blew a perfect hurricane was really afraid it would blow our old house down

1880
Dec 6th Wind blows fearfully and it is awful cold poor Annie Warswick came over this morning almost froze could not make a fire in her shanty stove pipe blown down
7th-8th-9 Awful cold weather 12th very mild had a small snow storm last night but it has nearly all thawed off to day 13th I went to Chicago to get Christmas things stayed all night at Willey's Mira came home with me found Lutie very sick with Diptheria I stoped there 15 Mira went to the Masqurade Ball with Sam & Ett 
20th Mira went back to Chicago 
Dec 25th very dull Christmas Etta had Mr and Mrs Smart and Arthurs folks to dinner Martha and family were at home alone Fannie was sent to Marthas as soon as Lutie was taken sick so she was all the company they had - I was at Ada s where I have been for almost two weeks Corbett Ada and I eat our dinner alone and in almost perfect silence scarcely a word being spoken we missed the little bright face of Fannie and poor little Lutie was too sick to eat or come to the table -- very different from our old time Hollidays when we all felt jolly and free and were all together and made as much hubbub as we pleased, and had plenty of friends to help us 
26th The weather has been somewhat remarkable the Sun has not shone for nearly three weeks it has been cloudy dark and dull and so perfectly still not a breeze stiring not very cold -- just enough so it does not throw any there is a little snow on the ground but not enough for sleighing 
Richard came down after Dr Tope Maude had scarlet fever -- Martha went to Chicago (23) Dec -- Ada and Ett (11th)

1881
Jan 1st Another new year has dawned upon us miserable sinners and found us all in comfortable health and circumstances Lutie has got quite smart Fannie has been home a week we all spent the day and evening at Ada's had an excellent turkey dinner with the usual accompaniments, and though we were not a very jubilant crowd, we enjoyed ourselves as well as could be expected, and nothing occured to mar our pleasure -- only the thoughts of the bereaved ones that so lately have lost near and dear friends that were not permitted to greet the new year--I cannot but feel sad when I think of all these things, and know for a certainty that our turn will soon come that our family circle will be broken, that dear familiar faces will be seen no more -- and loved voices will be silent We have had intensely cold weather the past week all over the country Thermometer ranging from 10 to 30 degrees in different parts of the country 
Jan 2d very pleasant comfortable day Lutie went out with her father for a short walk for the first time since she was sick -- 7th Rena sick with cold and sore throat they sent for me to come I have been at Adas over 3 weeks 
Jan 8th Martha Sam and Etta went to Chicago to hear Gough lecture went to Willey's to supper 
9th 10th very cold again -- 12th more mild Rena went over to Ada's Lutie very sick again 
Jan 13th Had quite a blustering snow storm but it got too cold to snow before night Dr Tope was married 5 o clock P.M
14th it was awful cold last night  22 degrees below zero this morning

1881
14th Made Annie Warswicks comforter -- Lutie much better 
15th It snowed all day Etta went to Chicago and surprised us all by bringing home a baby a little girl about 4 weeks old 
16th More snow Richard was down here this morning after Dr Tope Eddie sick 
21 Ada sick Martha had to go and stay with her, as I was not able 
Jan 22d Clarbel s birthday 23d snowed all day sleighing very fine Etta sick with a touch of Diptheria 27th Ett felling better 
29th Quite warm with a very fine misty rain but not enough to do any good 
30 The most beautiful day we have had this winter (that is in the forenoon) I went to the Baptist Church
